text: ...The very men who claimed mental superiority because they were free
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from superstitions and divine disillusionment were themselves victims of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their own sophism, and while they thought themselves crowned with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enlightenment, it was naught but the Phrygian caps of their prejudices
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: toward the material state.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: --Jehu, the Kinsman Redeemer
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The physical manifestation of the spiritual force is not the spiritual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: force at all, only a bland deception. If you only focus on what you can
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: see directly, than you chase after only the representation and not the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: object desired. If a bird is flying through the sky at noontime, casting
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a shadow on the ground below him, and a man comes along, and in the hope
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of catching the bird chases after its shadow, it is evident that he will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: never catch it, for when he does reach it, he will find that there is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nothing there at all, only the shadow of what it was he desired. So it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is with the spiritual!
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: --Onan, Lord of the Past
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 1: Past and Present
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: My name is Jehu. Most probably it sounds foreign and unfamiliar to you,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: devoid of the qualities of affection and personality which give
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: character to a name. It is a harsh name, cold and inhuman, like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: something out of the night, an unwelcome intruder into the warmth of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: familiarity. It inspires no blissful memories, nor does it kindle fond
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: feelings in the bosom of the hearer, instead the heart is hardened to it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like the feathers of a duck to water, repulsing it, leaving it to run
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: off into the ditches and by-ways of the long forgotten past, to trickle
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dejectedly into those stagnant ponds where so many words of wisdom are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: imprisoned: out of sight, out of mind, out of heart, out of history. Yet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: while history is forgotten and misconstrued, it is repeated, for what is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life without water, which nourishes and sustains it, and what is life
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: without wisdom, which protects and cultivates it?
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Jehu is my name, though it no longer brings the quickened pulse and keen
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anticipation of happiness to the hearts of any, not even my own. For
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what deference can be given to a name, though not in itself a thing of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dishonor, which represents the failure to derail the evitable fate which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wrecks the race of man again and again. Not that I myself embody such a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: failure, nor even that I gave birth to the dreaded fate's latest
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: momentum, but as is seen time and again throughout history, one name is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: brought to represent the tide of change, for better or worse, the doer
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of deeds which were done not by him, but by a mass of independent doers,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: yet it is written in the annals of history as the deeds of but one man.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: While I had little to do, consciously, with the doom of the earth, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: will always be fingered as the villain, as the ambitious Napoleon or the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: barbaric Atilla, the arrogant Augustus or the fearful Cyrus. Someone has
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to bear the burden of shame on the pages of history for the people of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his time, and in that sense, maybe I truly can be called their kinsman
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: redeemer. Perhaps it is my fate to bear witness to the wrongs of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: people, of which even you are not wholly innocent.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: And yet can an individual be blamed for the faults of a society, can
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: personal responsibility be extended to the members of an unknown
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: multitude? How the enjoined conscience of one longs to say no, but in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: good faith it cannot be said, for in this case the mask of ignorance
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cannot supersede the face of guilt. Indeed, ignorance in this case only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: adds to the shame of the guilty, this being a crime not of misdeeds but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of negligence, twisted together with the vices of humanity into a thick
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and sturdy cord, a rope that cannot be pulled apart and individually
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: examined, yet must be taken as a whole. Insularly, the strand of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ignorance could be easily snapped, remedied by but a little education,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: yet when woven together by one's own hands with prides and prejudices,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it forms an unbreakable rope, which is placed about our neck to hang us:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through means of our own doing is our fate foretold. If but one or two
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the strands were omitted, the result would be a feeble rope, easily
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: broken, and we would live. But by our own vices is our mortality made
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: manifest, by our own wrongs are we wronged.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: By now you may be beginning to feel the impulses of indignation arising
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in your breast, for who am I, the admittedly despicable Jehu, to group
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you as my fellow convicts, my co-conspirators, in a sense? And you are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: right, for I am not your judge and neither do I wish to be.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Having said that, I now request of you to put down the book and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: discontinue reading.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Surely," you say to yourself, "He is mentally deranged, for what author
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in his right mind would encourage his readers to disperse, what writer
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: does not thrive on the digestion of his words by an eager audience?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Here I must make a revelation to you: if my manuscript has indeed been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: found, then I have long since been dead; and I assure you that in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: whatever form my existence takes in the present, I have little desire
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for your intrigue or goodwill. Do you think Melville is consoled in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: death of his miserable life by the vainglorious praises of the living?
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Or do you think that Poe is comforted by such avid attentions in his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: present abode? In truth, Melville's only rivalry is now within, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Poe's only raven that daunting memory of those truths which had escaped
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: him in life, but which now are opened to you.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: More importantly, if this manuscript has been found, it proves that what
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is contained herein is the unerring truth. I do not write this to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: exonerate myself, however let me say here that I am more the Andre' than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Arnold, for I was but the emissary of history, not the traitor to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: humanity, and if not me then some other would have filled the void. Let
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it be remembered that it was Andre' who gave his life for his deeds, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: yet it is Andre' who is recollected with a sweet sorrow, and though
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Arnold lived, he had no peace. Yet while history is vivid and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: encyclopedic, in itself a living organism, it can speak only through the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mouths of men, who often misrepresent it for their own partisan and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prejudiced plans. It is strong and steadfast, though, and in time is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: always victorious over its menial opposition, for what is history but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the past tense of truth, and it is justly said that veritas numquam
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: perit, truth never dies.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Going back to what I said before, namely that at my manuscript's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: discovery my demise will itself be history: I am assured that such is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: true, for even now as I write this my death is near at hand. How wide
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the abyss of time that separates us is I cannot tell, but I do know that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it is beyond the reckoning of men, such an unknown barrage of hollow,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: formless years. Yet as you read this it is as if I were speaking
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: directly to you, despite all of the desolation between our times. That
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is what makes history an organic being, and by history I mean all of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: past, or all of the future, depending on your viewpoint.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: A book is a connection between times and peoples, more so than any other
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: medium. As I put these words down in writing, it is as if I am imparting
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: my very self into the pages. And as you read them, the name Jehu slowly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forms into an image, into a personality, and from the empty word Jehu
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: comes the great well of affection springing from a personal intimacy. A
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: book is an enigma in which no time exists, and as it is read it brings
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the reader into its eternal being, for while it sits closed on a shelf
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it is no more than a forgotten memory, yet when it is opened its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: contents come to life and its characters and locations are once more
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: existent in the same state as when they were written, the story becomes
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: once more reality.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: While I have long been deceased, when you read this I am brought to life
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: once more, and with my rebirth I tell you my story, and make known to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you the truths contained therein. The words of this book are a rune
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: gate, a portal to the past, and as you read them, your present fades
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: away and you are drawn into my present, this very moment in which I now
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: write. Then you connect with me intimately, and for a brief time the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: gulf of mortality is transcended and the depths of my being are laid
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: open to you. We commune together and you eat of my flesh and drink of my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: blood, merging your existence with mine.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Come to me now, my friend, come to me across the gulf of mortality, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I await you. Come, and in your spiritual peregrination meet with me, in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: this land of the past which is so foreign and unfamiliar to you, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which will become for a time your home. Come to me, my friend, and let
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me tell you my story.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 2: Predestined Deja Vu
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It was in the last stages of sleep that I began to feel the warm morning
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sun strike my face, and hear the pleasant chirping of birds and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: crickets. I rolled slowly over, stretched my legs and my back, and stood
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: up, with the last remnants of a dream playing quietly in my mind. But as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I came to my feet and got a clear view of where I was, I realized it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not a dream that I had had at all, but something far more sobering. I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: found myself somewhere in the center of a very large prairie which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: covered the land for many miles around. From the sun's lowly position on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the eastern horizon, it was evident to me that the new day was just
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dawning, casting a golden hue on the grasses that covered the prairie's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: surface.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Around the distant outskirts of the plain I could make out a ring of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: trees circumventing the whole, waving almost imperceptibly to and fro in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the light breeze that was blowing. A few miles to the southwest there
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was a group of odd looking trees stretching up over the horizon to a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: considerable height. They were closer than the outer ring, which kept a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: uniform girth around the prairie, but somehow they looked very peculiar
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and foreboding, and I got one of those sobering feelings which I like to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: call predestined deja vu. What I mean is that I got a sense of deja vu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but instead of the past converging with the present into one thought,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the present seemed to converge with the future, and the result was a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mysterious foreboding of something, though I couldn't tell what. That is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the sensation that I had when I saw what I assumed to be a small
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: grouping of trees somewhere in the southwestern portion of the savanna,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: though that was merely a guess, for in the distance I could only make
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: out several dark forms rising out of the grassland like trees, or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: possibly buildings, one of them being a great deal taller than the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: others, with a spherical shape on top that only faintly resembled a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tree's crown. If it was indeed a tree, it was the largest that I have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ever seen, for it looked to be upwards of 800 feet tall.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: My mental warning bells were ringing quite loudly, and I endeavored to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: silence them by extreme exertions of the will, but they would not be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: subdued. I assumed that they were not at all correct, much like the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fearful expectancy some have while swimming in the ocean, out of sight
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of all land, of being attacked by an enormous leviathan of the deep. As
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unfounded as the fear is, it places one into a frenzy of dubious
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thoughts that inspire equally frantic and anarchist actions. Because of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: this, I thought that my ideas were naught but superstitious fancies, yet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: try as I might, I could not rid myself of them.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Instead, I made up my mind to set off in the opposite direction, north,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and to advance at a double march until I should reach the woody border,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which looked to present shelter not only from the southern apparitions,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but also from the shielded underworld of the grasses, in which also
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dwelt the mysterious sense of fear and predestined deja vu. It was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: slightly chilly, but beyond that nothing defaced the temperate beauty of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the day, and even that promised to soon dissipate with the continual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: strengthening of the sun's warmth. As I walked, or rather, trotted
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: along, it did just that, and in the growing warmth of the day the sweet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fragrances of the many various grasses rose to the surface, delighting
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: my odor perceiving sensors with their earthy simplicity.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The day marched on, and with it I, and the distant wall of trees began
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to slowly grow closer. At length, I found myself at their edge, at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around the noon hour, and as I came upon the first of them, I leaned
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: against the trunk of a large, thickset tree for a moment of repose and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reflection in its shade. It was by all appearances an ancient wood, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the line between it and the prairie was distinct, appearing as if the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shrubs and lesser flora had acquiesced to fate and retreated beyond the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forest's claimed boundaries, rather than continue for countless ages to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: charge and then be pushed back, to gain a foothold only to be thrown out
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a year or two later. The trees themselves were mighty pinions of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: strength, tall and of great girth, and spread far apart from one
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: another, leaving wide open spaces between their towering trunks. A
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: short, soft grass clothed the land that stretched on in their midst,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: joined in its solitude by a hearty looking moss that stretched itself
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: out on the trunks of the trees and on the rocks and boulders that lay
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scattered here and there among the open spaces. Far above, the trees'
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great branches spread out a thick canopy, covering the whole of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forest area in a relaxing and invigorating twilight, rendering itself
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: homely and quaint. After a few moments of enjoying that most pleasing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scene, I roused and extricated myself unwillingly from its enchanted
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: depths and set off once more into the heart of the woods, having no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: where else to go.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: After a time, I cannot say how long, I came upon a small, trickling
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stream which flowed deeper into the woods, that direction being
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: northward. A short walk along its path, after refreshing myself to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: content with its pure waters, brought me to its destination: a large
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lake into which the forest opened. Its banks were very gradual and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: grass of the woodland led right up to the water's edge. The surface of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the water itself was smooth and delicate.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Amidst the pleasantness of the scene, there was something missing from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the feel of the area: inhabitants. There was an abundance of wild life
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of all kinds, and much organic life as well, but something greater than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: flora or fauna was missing: people. I had traveled so far, and without
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any sighting of a person. It was a lonely and desolate feeling which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prevailed, despite the abundances of life. Novelties soon grow worthless
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with no one to share them with, ideas become meaningless if not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: communicated timely, emotions grow boisterous and uncontrollable with no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: end to receive them.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was quite alone, unfortunately, and it dampened my spirits
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: considerably. Feeling despondent, I turned and walked sullenly from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lake's edge into the woodland once more, with no definite purpose in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mind, only a meandering thought of my dismal situation. My thoughts
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: morphed, in succession, from anxiety to despair, to anger, to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: frustration, and in my frustration I knelt down and picked up a fallen
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: branch from the ground, walked to the nearest tree, and eyed a strange,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: protruding knob that stuck out from the trunk. I held the branch at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shoulder's length and swung it at the knob with all the force of my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: built up emotions. It hit with a crash and a hollow thud, leaving the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: branch broken and my arm sore, but the knob undamaged.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: But then something unexpected happened: with a grating noise, a small
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hole appeared part way up the trunk, coming from what looked to be solid
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wood, for no sign was seen before of its having an opening. From the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: newly opened hole was then thrust out a head, hairy and with a short
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: snout-like edifice for a nose and mouth. Its eyes and the furry hair
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which covered its face were brown, and a few wily whiskers protruded
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from its snout. With a look of utter surprise, as if it had not expected
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me as much as I had not expected it, it eyed me closely for a moment and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: then looked anxiously from side to side and told me to come in.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When those words passed its lips, or whatever artifice it spoke from, a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great weight fell from my shoulders. After a short moment, quickened by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: my relief, a door appeared in the trunk of the tree, its edges
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: previously hidden behind the thick mosses. Swinging inwards, it opened
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and revealed the creature standing there, beckoning me to enter. I did,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the door shut behind me, leaving me in the darkness of the hollow
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tree.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 3: Zards and Canitaurs
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: My eyes quickly adjusted to the darkness, and once they did I saw that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the trunk was hollowed out to the extent of eight feet in diameter, with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: two stairways, one up and another down, filling either corner of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: small entry room in which I found myself. Observing that my vision was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: returned enough to see, the strange creature which had greeted me led me
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: down the descending staircase for a short way, until we came into a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cavern which was delved beneath the roots of the tree.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The walls and floor of the cavern, or more accurately, the sitting room,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for such it appeared to be, were paneled with a thick, heavy wood with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: an almost artificially symmetric grain, and the ceiling was done in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: diagonal boards of the same. Sitting in the center of the room was a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: brick-laid pit in which burned an illuminating fire, and around it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: placed an odd covering frame that caught up the smoke and channeled it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: via underground passages to some distant wilderness, where its sightless
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: remnants would dissipate into the atmosphere unnoticed. On the near side
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the fire was a round table flanked by four large, comfortable chairs,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: padded by cushions made from the same material as the various carpets
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and tapestries around the room.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There were two more of the strange creatures seated at the table, called
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaurs as I later found out, and as they are closely entwined with my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: story, being prominent participants, I will describe them in some detail
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: here. They stood erect like a man, yet were quite contrasted in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appearance. Their skin for one was covered in a thick, impenetrable coat
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of hair, much like a dog or a bear's. Their hands, also, were less
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: distinct in the fingers, though but slightly, and their limbs were a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: little longer and thicker than a man's. The two most notable
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: differences, however, were the formation of their shoulders and chest,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which were very pronounced and muscular, and their faces. The latter's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: features were brought to a point in the short snout, or muzzle, that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: formed their nose and mouth, taking their chins with it and leaving a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: long line from their neck to their chest open. Humanity prevailed in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rest of their features, though, giving them the look of a man and canine
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hybrid.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: By then I had overcome my initial perplexion at the sight of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaurs, and I endeavored to put a strong check over my emotions in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: order to prevent another outbreak of panic and to remain cool and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: candid, come what would. Yet it was, ironically, the product of my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rashness that I had found their habitation at all. This I successfully
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: did, and as I entered the room, led by the Canitaur who was on watch,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the others stood politely and greeted me with an apparent intrigue.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Our conversation proceeded at follows:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am Wagner of the Canitaurs, my friend," said the one who appeared to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: be the leader, "And these are Taurus and Bernibus," the latter being the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one who had led me down. "Welcome to Daem."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am Jehu," I told them, "It is a pleasure to meet you."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Indeed, and under such circumstances as well. Tell me, how did you come
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to be here?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Here I smiled nervously, and replied, "I am a traveler from a distant
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: land, and came here by the advice of a friend."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: At this somewhat false answer, more in character than in content, Wagner
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: looked at me wonderingly, as if detecting my falsehood, but did not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: follow his look with any probing questions, to my great relief. In order
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to steer the conversation away from this point, I added quickly, "I am
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not at all disappointed, either, for the landscape is beautiful and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: trees and foliage are wondrously large, but I was surprised to find
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that, from the prairie to the lake, I saw no one living among these
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: quaint locations."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner looked at me closely, with a hint of almost reverencing respect
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and said, "You were very fortunate in your travels, I assure you, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had you arrived at any other time, you would have fallen into fouler
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hands than ours by far."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I do not understand what you mean," I said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Of course not, I am forgetting your new arrival has left you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unacquainted with affairs that I am faced with everyday. Let me explain:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we, that is, the Canitaurs, have been in open hostilities with the other
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: group of people on this island, the Zards, for as long as we can
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: remember. They have great military superiority in this section of Daem,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and when we come here we are forced to live in hiding, in outposts such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as this one."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Why not just make peace?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Because it is our ideologies that conflict, neither group of us will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: yield, and the solution can only be decided by force, military force. It
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is fortunate that you have come among us first, for they would have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mistreated you."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "So you have said, though I do not see why I was not captured by them on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: my journey through the plains, if they are as powerful in this quarter
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as you say," I replied.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "As I said, the timing of your arrival was very fortunate," he said, "At
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any other time you would have surely been caught, and then your fate
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would have been uncertain, but yesterday was the Zard's new year, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Kootch Patah, on which they spend all night in celebrations and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: revelries. Because of this, they were all soundly asleep on your trip
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through the prairie, very possibly laying at your feet, covered by the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tall grasses."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: So my fears were not as unfounded as I had thought, was my predestined
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: deja vu, then, real as well? Only time would tell.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am indeed lucky then, as you have said, not only in the Zard's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unattentiveness, but also in finding of your secreted habitation, as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: well as your friendly welcoming of me," I said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I must confess," he chuckled, "It is not merely from a one-sided
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hospitality that you are welcomed."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Indeed?" I said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Indeed," he answered, "For your appearance and the circumstances of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your arrival are almost uncannily the realizations of one of our most
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ancient prophesies, one which we have longed to have fulfilled."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Is that so?" I rhetorically asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Surely it is," he said with a smile, though from happiness or humor I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: could not tell. He went on soberly, saying: "The prophecy is concerning
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the kinsman redeemer, one of the ancients sent by Onan, the Lord of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Past, to redeem us from the destruction of this polluted world."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What do you mean by 'one of the ancients'?" I interjected
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: questioningly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Exactly what I said," Wagner replied with a light hearted smile, "Let
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me explain."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: But before he could, we were interrupted by a violent scratching and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pounding at the door, along with some grunting voices which I could not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: understand. The Canitaur's ears, which were quite large, though more
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: erect and postured than floppy, quickly rose to attention, and they had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spent not a moment listening when they uniformly chorused, "Zards," in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hoarse whisper. My earlier fear, then mysterious but now understood,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: returned in full force, and my face writhed in horror as I ejaculated
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: remorsely, "Then we are lost."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner turned gravely towards me and said, "Perhaps, but there is still
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hope. Come, follow me," and rising from his chair he led the way to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: furthest corner of the room. A primitive tapestry was hanging there, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner lifted it up while Bernibus and Taurus hit two hidden switches,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one being on either extremity of the room, to avoid discovery. That
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unlocked the wall behind the tapestry. It opened along lines previously
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: concealed by the wood's grain and revealed a small cubbyhole built into
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the wall, probably meant for its present use, concealment. Wagner led us
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: into it and no sooner was the door, or wall, latched again than the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Zards, having broken down the outside door by brute strength, flooded
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: into the room.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We could see them as they did, for the wall that concealed us had many
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: small holes, and the tapestry as well, so that on the inside we could
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: see all that happened in the well lit room, while they could not see us,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as there was no light to reveal us. Indeed, I had been sitting facing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the hidden compartment during our brief dialog and had not detected it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: at all. The situation was quite different at that time, though, for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Zards were actively looking for us, whereas I was merely glancing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: occasionally at the wall.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Now that they were closer, I could easily understand their conversation:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Blast it, they aren't here," said one,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Probably deserted the place after Garlop saw them, he should have kept
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: watch."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Why? He couldn't have stopped a group of them, and they're too keen to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: be followed."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Aye, he did right to hurry off, but it would be a shame if they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: escaped," another joined.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The King is here though, and there's no fooling him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Hear ye, hear ye," the others assented, that being a common phrase
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: among them which was the equivalent of an 'I agree' or 'Amen'.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: A larger, more commanding Zard, whom the others looked in deference to,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: then came down the stairs, saying as he entered the room, "Let us not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: celebrate prematurely, gentlemen. There is nothing of interest above, so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we will have to search carefully down here."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Sir, is it true it was a hairless one he saw?" one asked him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "We are all hairless here," he said, laughing with the others, "But yes,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it is reported that Garlop saw one of the ancients, and with his sharp
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: eyes and knowledge of history, it is assumed to be true. I need not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: remind you, then, the need to find them before they are too far away, it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is imperative to the cause that the ancient is not brought to the hidden
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fortress of our adversaries."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The Zards then set to work with great assiduity searching for any clues
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the Canitaur's whereabouts, examining everything meticulously, yet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: quickly. They tore the furniture apart to look for hidden compartments,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: followed the smoke pipes through the ground to their outlets, tore off
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the floor boards to look for secret passages, and did the same to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ceiling.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Before I continue with my story, let me pause for a moment to describe
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to you the appearance of the Zards, for you are probably curious as to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what they look like.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Quite different from the Canitaurs, they were, in fact, completely
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hairless, being almost lizard-like. They stood erect, about the same
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: height as a man, that is, about six feet or a little over that, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their bodies resembled those of alligators, with short, thickset legs,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stout arms, and a long body with a tail draping down to the ground,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: looking like a giant tongue, though covered, of course, in scales. Their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: heads were small, having a little skull on which were the eyes and ears
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and with a long snout that, like the Canitaurs', held their noses,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mouths, and chin. Huge, sharp teeth filled their mouths and gave them an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: odd, fiercely sophisticated look. Their hands were thick with long
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fingers, and though their overall appearance had an air of awkwardness
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: about it, they set to their tasks with great dexterity, though if it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: natural or the result of their excited state, I could not tell. Indeed,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I began to grow worried when the Zard who was removing the walls, to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: check for holes or tunnels, drew near to us as he methodically pried off
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the panels with a metal bar and looked for anything suspicious.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He moved along quickly and was just about to put the bar to our covering
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and pull when another Zard, on the other end of the room, held aloft a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: piece of paper, calling the attentions of the others to it. Our almost
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: discoverer went himself to the other Zard, and we were, for a moment at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: least, saved from being exposed. Having read the paper, the taller Zard,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the King, said to the others, "Well done, lads. We have here a map to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Canitaur's hidden fortress. Let us go to Nunami, gather some troops,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and surprise them. Today may prove victorious, so let us hurry."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The others assented and as a body they went up the stairs and out the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: door, hurrying forth, it seemed, to do their dastardly deeds, and in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their ardor not leaving behind even a single one to guard the hideout.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Despite our good fortunes, my spirits were damp, for my sorrow of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaur's ill fate was as a wound in my bosom, knowing that I had been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the sole reason for their discovery. What a good kinsman redeemer, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thought, for my coming may have ended the wars, or put its completion in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: motion, yet not in the favor of my hosts.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: To my chagrin, however, the Canitaurs, led by Wagner, were buxom,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: seeming to find great humor in what had happened. Turning to them in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: zealous perplexity, I said spiritedly, "How can you laugh? You may have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: escaped, but your brethren are doomed, and you yourselves will not last
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: long around enemies without the protection of the other Canitaurs."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: But my rebuke only seemed to make their laughter and mirth more hearty,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and they raged on without ceasing for a time. After a while, when they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were reduced to a smiling remnant of their former pleasure, Wagner
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: turned gravely towards me and said, "Forgive me, Jehu, for not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: explaining it to you. You are right to chastise us, but the situation is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not as you seem to think it, for the map they found was a fake, and will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lead them to nowhere of importance, while we affect our escape. We are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lucky that they left no guard, but come, let us not tempt fate and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: remain any longer in this compromised outpost, to the fortress we go!"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He finished and met with the approbations of the others, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: accordingly, we exited the cubby hole and made our way through the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rummaged room, up the stairs, and out of the tree. It was now early
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: evening, and the temperance of twilight, with its soft and mellow
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: splendors, only increased the pleasantness of the area. A slight breeze
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prevailed and rustled the leaves and boughs of the giant trees just
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enough to render it pacifying and comforting. Being quickened by the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: breeze, the lake danced on in its earlier smoothness, only in a faster
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tempo, improving the ruggedness of the watery wrinkles. The last
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: visiting rays from the sun were congregated on the eastern shores,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: saying their good-byes to the glowing trees, and giving their parting
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: respects before being whisked away to their native lands of fire, to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: come again in great numbers on the morrow.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We set off around the lake, making our way northward towards the rugged
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mountains rising before us in a grand show of might. Wagner and Taurus
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: walked before and behind us, respectively, Wagner leading the way and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Taurus erasing the marks of our passing, and both watching for any signs
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of ambush. Bernibus walked abreast of myself, keeping me in pleasant
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: company, for he was a very enjoyable companion.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: During our walk, Bernibus and I had an insightful conversation, of which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I will relate to you the following, as you may find it interesting:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Tell me," I said to him, "You seem to be a jovial people, despite the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: war that you find yourselves in, but are all of your people of the same
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: attitude?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very nearly, yes," he replied, "For though we do not wish war, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: principles at stake here are important enough for us to sacrifice an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: easy life for them. We've grown used to it, everything is done in such a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: way as to promote secrecy and stealth, those being our main advantages
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in the conflict. Out of hundreds of outposts like the one we were just
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in, for example, only four others have ever been discovered, and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Zards still have no clue where our fortress is." This he said in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: boastful manner, but as he did a faint spirit of sorrow spread across
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his face for an instant, as if in memory of one of the raids of previous
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: times.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "That explains their rapture when they found the false map," I returned,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But I must admit that I am still ignorant of the cause of the wars. It
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was said that it was conflicting ideologies, yet that is self-evident,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as all conflict is at heart just that. I don't mean, either, the actions
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that caused the most recent inflammation, but what exactly your
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conflicting ideologies are? What is it that keeps you from harmony?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You have a knack for hard questions," he said with a smile. Then he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: paused for a moment to collect his thoughts. At length, he continued,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The Canitaurs have a profound respect for all that has gone before us,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we honor the traditions of our ancestors and revere their beliefs and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their ideas of truth. The past, in the guise of history, is the key to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the future, we believe, and we hold strictly to the worship of Onan, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Lord of the Past," at this my attention was perked. He continued, "Our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: adherence to the ways of our ancestors is based on the idea that what
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: has continued throughout the ages has continued because it is right,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that it has remained steadfast because it is based on the immovable
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: foundations of reality. We follow Onan because he is real, because the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: past has existed, and it is certain that it will continue to exist, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: because that existence dictates the operation of the present. Although
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we may seem ritualistic and entrenched in tradition to the outside
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: observer, we enjoy the comforts of knowing that we are on a well tread
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: path, that we are not alone in time but in company with our forebears.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We are called the Pastites because of our beliefs, because of our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tradition based lives that instill in us a reliance on history, on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: events of the past as a light by which to guide our own actions, as a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: road paved by the flesh and blood of our forefathers which leads to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happiness and peace."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus paused for another moment, as if in contemplation once again,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before he continued, saying, "The Zards are followers of the future, or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Futurists as they are called. They believe that the past is just that,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the past: the ignorant and selfish times of the unenlightened who were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: too shrouded by prejudices to understand the world clearly. Instead they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: place their faith in the scientific and philosophical ideas of the day,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: believing that while history and the past were delegated to the control
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the unsophisticated whose ways were superstitious and outdated, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: present contains truth in its pure form. Reform and revolution are their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: watchwords, for they tinker with the very foundations of society and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life in an attempt to cultivate it. Zimri is their Lord, of the Future,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and they follow him loosely, for he doesn't require the strict adhesion
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that Onan does, which suits their independent and relaxed world view
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: very well."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He went on, in summary, "In a word, the Pastites believe that history,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the reality of the past, governs the present and the future, while the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Futurists believe that the future defines the present and the past."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I begin to see the differences," I replied in a humble, questioning
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: manner, "And yet they seem to me to be passive, secondary differences,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the kind that result in a conflict of subtle disagreements here and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there, argued over dessert like tariffs or taxes, not at all violent.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: How is it that they take such a prominent role in everyday life that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they can only be resolved by force? What is it that takes it from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fireside to the battlefield?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Here I was slightly taken aback by the expression on Bernibus' face, it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was one of surprise mingled with apprehension and questioning. He said,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Then you do not know?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Know what?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He laughed, "I take it you do not." Becoming solemn again, he continued,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Our land, Daem is on the edge of ruin, and has been for all of my life
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and those of many generations before me. About 530 years ago there was a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great war on earth, one in which no restraint was used, no mutually
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: assured destruction, for nuclear weapons came into the hands of those
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: who cared not for any life, not even their own. Tensions were high for a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: decade, and in the following segregation, the peoples of the earth lost
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their personal connection with their enemies, and, as always happens,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ceased to view them as equals, but instead as evil ones bent on their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: destruction. Things came to such a crisis that at last a little flame
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was lit and it grew and grew until it became a full scale nuclear war.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The destruction was total: no one was exempt, as almost everything, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: everyone, was destroyed. The only surviving place was this island, which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is the sole habitat of the delcator beetle, a small insect that digests
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nuclear waste and neutralizes it. The first few decades were horrible,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before the atmosphere recovered enough to return to normal, and in that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: time things mutated and grew gigantic. The trees and foliage, as you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: see, are an example of this, even the redwood trees of old were nothing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: compared to the trees of Daem. And the Zards and Canitaurs grew and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: changed as well, and, as we lived on either ends of the island, as we do
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: now, our forms morphed into the separate forms that they now take.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "And that is where our conflict turned violent," he continued, "For it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is our desire, on both sides, to return the earth to its previous state.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The Pastites want to return through time and stop the destruction before
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it happens, because we believe that the past is what must be changed in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: order to change the present and future. It is the actions of the past
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that brought about the present woes, and it is they that must be undone.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: For their part, the Futurists want to change the present through the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: future, to go into the future and bring back its completion, in the form
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of restored RNA cells, which is congruent with their belief that the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: past is the past and all that matters is that which is yet to come, that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which still has the hope of existence."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I looked at him as he finished and said, "But, why not do both. Wouldn't
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that be more effective than fighting each other? How can continued
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: destruction revert previous destruction inflicted in the same manner?
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Could not both ideas be tried?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "If only they could," he replied. "It goes back to Onan and Zimri, you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: see, for we ourselves cannot do such things, but the gods whom we follow
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: can. Shortly after the worldwide destruction, we, meaning both the Zards
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the Canitaurs, received the prophesy of the kinsman redeemer, who
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would be sent to help us change the earth to its former majesty. He was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to be one from the time right before the beginning of the final
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: firefight, one of the ancients who still kept the pure human form. Our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hostilities broke out in an attempt to control the entire island, so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that when he should come, the dominant force would have him. Each side
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was convinced that theirs was the right way, the only way through which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the end of restoring the earth's ecosystem could be reached. You are the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: kinsman redeemer, Jehu, for you fit the prophecy perfectly, and I am
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: glad that you have fallen in with us."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: After his discourse, Bernibus fell into a silent meditation, as did I,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the rest of our walk through the now dark wilderness was one of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: silence and solitude. Given the cessation of action in my narrative, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: will take this opportunity to describe the circumstances of my arrival
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: on the island of Daem, about which you are no doubt wondering.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 4: Onan, Lord of the Past
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Not wishing to delve too far into my past or relate what would be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mundane and disconnected with my story, I will summarize with brevity
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what my situation was. I was a military man, an Air force pilot to be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: exact, and was on active duty patrolling the no-fly zones off the coast
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of China, it being, at that time, an area of very high tensions. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: situation was grim, as any small incident promised to set the pendulums
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of war into motion, but the worst had subsided, and things were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: beginning to look as if that incendiary incident wouldn't come after
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all. The main part of my story begins on a cloudy night of what was to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me just a few weeks back, though it seems like many ages ago now, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: indeed, it was.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was flying over an area that was littered with small volcanic islands,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the type that rise above or fall below sea level continually, so that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what one year is above water is later below. Some of them have even been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: known to only rise above the waves for a short time, and then vanish
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from the sea completely, worn down by wind and waves. The night was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: murky, and the air was thick with water and dust, the result being that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there was no natural light whatsoever, and any artificial light that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: could be mustered was largely reduced to nothing, visibility being no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: more than twenty feet.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The wind was calm and the flying, though strenuous from lack of sight,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was without turbulence. I was doing well, until out of nowhere I heard a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: loud crack of thunder, followed by a bolt of lightning that hit the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: plane. At once I lost all of the instruments, excepting the actual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: control of the plane in manual, meaning that the radar and all the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: guidance systems were crippled, and I could see nothing. Not knowing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what to do, and not being able to radio for help, I pulled down and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: slowed until I was just barely remaining airborne, and began looking for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: an island to land on.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Once below 200 feet, the clouds gave way and I saw an island. I aimed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for it and slowed more, preparing to land on it. I did, though just
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: barely, for it was extremely small, being one of those inconsistent
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: volcanic islands. Getting out of the plane, I was greeted by a strong
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: blast of wind that was dripping water from its cold grip, and I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instantly chilled to the bone. There was nothing on the island at all,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: except for the hole in its center, from which, no doubt, came the lava
title: The Revolutions of Time
