author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that had formed it. It was on a slightly elevated hill, and looked as if
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it had not erupted for many thousands of years. With nothing to do at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that moment except to get an idea of the island that I had landed on, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: walked over to it and knelt down beside it, peering blankly into its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: depths. It seemed to be absolutely devoid of light, and, as often
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happens, its darkness was mysterious to me, for I wondered what lay
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hidden in it, and my curiosity got the better of my common sense. I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: leaned slowly forward. Then, as I did so, I heard a loud and terrible
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: voice, personified in the crashing of the waves and the moaning of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wind, and it said in a monotonous and unending refrain, "Enter." Nothing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: more nor less than the continual repetition of that word. This alarmed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me, and as I did not want to do that, I began to stand upright and back
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: away from it, to return to my plane. But as I raised my knee from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ground in order to stand, my other knee slipped under the increased
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pressure, and in the ensuing instability, I completely lost my balance
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and fell forward into the hole.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There are certain events in our lives that change the whole course of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our existence, and falling forward into the hole was one for me. Its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: immediate effects weren't injurious to me at all, but it matured with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: time, like a good wine, and grew until it overcame me, starting the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: chain of events which would result in my demise. Yet not only mine, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that of everyone.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Let me continue, though, and I will explain what I mean and not confuse
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you more. I landed with a thud on a pile of soft dirt some twenty feet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: down, in a dark place which seemed open, not cavernous and cramped as I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would have expected. My eyes adjusted to the darkness, and as they did,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I realized it was not now totally lightless, for there was a faint glow
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: coming from somewhere in the distance. Looking up through the passage I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had come down, I saw that there was no way to climb up it, and,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: accordingly, set off to find the source of the faint light that came
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from the distance. After walking cautiously through the darkness, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reached a curve and then a tunnel-like exit to the spacious cavern that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was in, and as I turned it I saw the source of the light: lava flows.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The room, or area, I had entered was rather thin and round, with a river
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of lava flowing downwards and a small ledge of rock winding along its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: edge. Together they descended spirally downwards at a gentle angle,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: taking the form of an intelligently designed ramp. As I followed it down
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I soon broke out in a sweat, for the gurgling, fiery plasma heated the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: area up to a warm degree.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I found myself looking intently at the flowing fire beside which I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: walked, its strangeness stealing my meditations from other things, and I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: looked at it absorbingly, not paying attention to the path that I walked
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: on, so entranced was I with the feeling that its boiling character gave
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to me.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As I walked along the lava preoccupied with my meditations and not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: paying conscious attention to the path, my subconscious was carefully
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: monitoring my way, and when once my eyes glanced upward, I quickly saw
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that my surroundings had changed. The narrow, spiral descending tunnel
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had given way to a very cavernous area where the lava flow formed a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: large lake of fire. A domed ceiling crowned this great room, though not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: exact and polished, having instead a rough appearance as it stretched
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from wall to wall, a semi-chasm of a hundred yards, more or less, with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its uppermost height being not less than twenty yards. On the far walls
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were two lava falls, trickling from raised tunnels in the wall into the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: body of lava, which covered the whole bottom of the room. There was a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: platform that sat in the middle of the fiery lake, connected to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tunnel I had come from by a walkway of stone. This room was different
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than the other two, also, in its fashion, for while the previous had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: vague evidences of intelligent design, this one was very obviously
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: artificially decorated. The walkway above mentioned was of ornate stone
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with an intricate design of circles, squares, and triangles carved into
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it, and on each corner of the center stage was a long pillar that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reached from floor to ceiling, each carved like a totem pole, with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: variety of animals and shapes stacked upon one another. The dome was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: done ornately as well, for I saw as I walked further into the room that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what I had thought had been imperfections in the dome proved to be an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: elaborate three dimensional sculpture that stuck out from the ceiling,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: depicting an intricate scene of figures and telling a story of some
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great saga of war and peace, pride and prejudice, love and hate, faith
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and betrayal, all combined to make the greatest mural: history, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: story of time itself.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As I looked in awe upon its beauty, I was startled by a voice coming
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from an unseen figure somewhere on the center platform. It said, "Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you have come at last. Welcome."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The voice was very gentle and pleasing to the ears, slowly and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: confidently spoken, meticulously articulated. I looked around in its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: direction and saw a short, elderly gnome with a long white beard
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reaching to his chest and a short crop of hair on his oblong head, which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was outfitted with a sharp, angular nose, a pair of sparkling eyes, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: two protruding ears. He was no more than four feet tall, and no less
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than three, with a dignified poise to him, and was dressed in a dark
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: robe with a black and gold design on it. We looked at each other for a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moment, he smiling pleasantly and me expressionless, for though I felt
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that I should be surprised, or at least bewildered, at the sight of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: gnome in an underground cavern, I was not, it was as if I had almost
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been expecting it to happen, as if in the back of my mind I had already
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been there and done that. Perhaps it was only a case of predestined deja
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: vu, or maybe it was something less tangible. Either way, the gnome then
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: broke the silence again, saying:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Let me introduce myself, Jehu. I am Onan, the Lord of the Past, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: these are the Chambers of History."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He then paused for a moment, waiting for my reaction, which was, again,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not too much surprised, but rather complacent, thought I didn't look
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: bored or snobbish, as is sometimes the case in that situation. Instead I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: became as genial as possible, realizing that whatever force was behind
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: this, it was greater than I.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Hello, Onan, it is pleasure to meet you," I said, advancing with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: proffered hand extended towards him, which I realized belatedly made me
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appear oafish, but he took it good-naturedly, and with his pleasantness
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: eliminated my unease at shaking the hand of one half my size. He then
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: beckoned for me to follow him, and turned and walked to the center of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the platform, where he unexpectedly laid down on his back, facing the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: muraled dome. I did the same, somewhat hesitantly, though I found it to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: be quite comfortable once I was down. He saw my sluggishness and by way
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of explanation said to me:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Do not be troubled, my dear Jehu, for we lie on our backs to bring
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: about clarity of mind."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Then he continued speaking, calling my attention to the sculptured dome:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "That is history," he said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What do you mean," I asked, "I've always viewed history as an organic
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being, constantly growing as it devours the present."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It is an organic being," he replied, "A monstrous beast of sorts. But
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that (meaning the mural on the dome), my friend, is the genetics of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: history, its code that dictates what it is and what it will become, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: master plan."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Allow me to take a moment to describe the mural for you. Firstly, its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: form: it was spread out across the dome like the painted ceiling of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Sistine Chapel, its whole being a broad, harmonious picture that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: complimented itself, telling a story throughout its united branches. It
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was much more than a painting, though, because it stood out from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dome like a group of completely independent sculptures, but placed so as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to tell the combined story with a sort of native ease, not stressed or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: artificial, yet seeming as natural and beautiful as water in its flowing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: grace. Now I will endeavor to describe its content, though I realize
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that in this case the picture must be worth many millions of words.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The center of the mural was its beginning, and there a man was standing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: proudly upright, dressed in splendid clothes of fine linens. He held in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his hand a magnificent cup of gold with a row each of diamonds, rubies,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sapphires, and pearls running along its breadth. It contained a dark red
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: liquid, which appeared to be boiling, and the man was holding it out to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a fierce lion whose shoulders were four feet across and whose mouth was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like a cavern, with stalactites and stalagmites of the most terrifying
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nature. With an evil glare in its eyes toward the man, the lion drank
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thirstily from the cup. Around the man and the lion there was a ring of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: blazing fire, leaping out of the dome like great pillars of flame,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: entrapping them within its narrow circle. On the outside of the fire was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a group of mighty lizards and beasts, the smallest of which was larger
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than several elephants. Their whole attention was paid to a great fight
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in which they were engaged, yet their foe was naught but the reflections
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of themselves on the great sea which surrounded the island that held
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: these strange sights. Several of them were dead or severely wounded at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: having been accidentally mauled by their fighting brethren. Across the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ocean from the island there was another landmass, whose far edges were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not in sight. On it were many ape-men bowing down in worship of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: gigantic White Eagle which was soaring far above them with a multitude
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of lords and ladies gripped in its massive talons. The lords were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dressed in silken robes and adorned with many pieces of fine jewelry,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the ladies were clothed in skirts of crimson; both groups had upon
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their faces looks of pleasure, and contempt towards those far below
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Onan continued speaking, "You see, Jehu, the whole of history, both that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: now written and that yet to come, is planned, executed according to its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: own power, for the course of time is marked as clearly as the tides: by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its own coming and going it is revealed. Revealed, however, only in an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: abstract and undefined manner, so that while its marks are clearly seen,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it is only by special revelations that it is shown in a comprehensive
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and detailed light. And that is why I have summoned you here, my dear
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Jehu, for you are the chosen one, summoned to help me."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was skeptical and asked him, "You summoned me? But how, I was to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forced to crash land on the island by the weather, and accidentally fell
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: into the volcano's mouth. It was by my own freewill decisions that the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: circumstances of my arrival here were fulfilled."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Onan laughed quietly and said, "History is not an unstoppable machine,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: allied with fate to control the destiny of all things past and future,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nor does it nullify the power of man's freewill, yet the force that acts
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: upon the minds of men to form them is history itself. You see, men are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not the opponents of history and fate, for they do not impede its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: progress with their freewill decisions, instead they are its minions,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its slaves, building up its strength and carrying out its dictates by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its influence, so that they become history as they serve it, adding to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its organism their own consciouses. While you were brought to these
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chambers by circumstances of your own choosing, your desires in choosing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: those circumstances were dictated by the experiences of the past. But
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: never mind how I summoned you, for you are here now."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very well," I said, not wishing to disagree with the Lord of the Past.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Still, I was in a stubborn frame of mind, and asked, "But if the past is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as powerful as you construe it to be, then why does the Lord of the Past
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: need the help of a mere mortal like myself? Or do you mean you need a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: more direct agent than those you control only by influence?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Something like that," he answered. "You see, there was a great disaster
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: once, which was blamed on me, and in order to atone for it, I promised
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to send a kinsman redeemer before anything so devastating happened
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: again, and I believe you are the perfect choice."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What devastating event hasn't been blamed on the past in one form or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: another?" I said, "But why not just go yourself?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It is against the rules," Onan told me.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "How typical."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, indeed, I sometimes wonder what good it is to be a god if you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: can't do anything yourself," he said with a sigh.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What do you want me to do there, then?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I cannot tell you, unfortunately."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Against the rules?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very much so. All that I can do is send an agent with a slight
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: understanding of the situation of history and physical existence to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: people, but he must make the judgments of how to proceed all on his own.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: If I did tell you, it wouldn't be much different than going myself, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: then there would be no human resolution to human problems."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Our lives serve as a spectator sport to the gods, then?" I inquired of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am afraid not," he said, "It is much more serious than that. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Greeks were not all wrong, you know."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Who else, I wonder."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Not many," he sighed, "But tell me, are you ready?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "As I'll ever be."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Then I will begin. The understanding of life begins with the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: understanding of physical existence," Onan said, "And by physical
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: existence I mean the quality of being materially animated. Not to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: confuse it with consciousness, which is the ability to think and reason,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it is rather the realm in which one has substance and continuity. I will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: call the elements of physical being time and matter, those words
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: representing widely known concepts. Matter provides the raw substance
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and time gives those lifeless objects a plane of being to exist in.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Without time, matter can do nothing except sit in a sterile state, in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: vacuum in which nothing could occur; and without matter, time would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: flow, but nothing would move with it. Thus, the basis of physical
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: existence is time and matter, each being useless separately, yet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: together being the perfect combination of a tangible object and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fluid, forward movement to animate it. Imagine it as a three-dimensional
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: painting, matter given depth by time."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Not so complicated," I said cheerfully.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Not yet, you mean," he laughed.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Exactly, tell me more."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Not just yet, Jehu. First you must help me."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The time to begin has come then?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, you must go now," he said, "And remember, I'll be watching.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Good-bye."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: And with that, not even standing up, Onan put me into a deep state of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: comatose and sent me through time to the unknown lands and people whom I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was to deliver. I awoke, as you will remember, in the center of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: savanna. Now that you know the circumstances of my arrival on Daem, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: will go back to where I was before: on the way to the Canitaur's hidden
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fortress.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 5: The Treeway
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was walking in silence through the rugged forests of northern Daem
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: alongside Bernibus the Canitaur, with his fellows Wagner and Taurus
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before and behind us, respectively, the former leading the way, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: latter covering our tracks, and both on the lookout for an ambush. An
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: entire lifetime of guerrilla warfare and privations of all kinds had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instilled in the Canitaurs a strong and prevailing sense of caution,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which sometimes rendered their lighthearted and almost spiritually
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: frivolous nature to the casual observer a dense, deceiving demeanor used
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to conceal their true selves. But that was not the case, I believe, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they were, or at least Bernibus was, truly amorous in personality.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The sky was then in its deepest dark, and in the few breaks in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: canopy above large enough to be seen through, there were few celestial
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lights to illuminate the depths of that mountainous forest. The forest
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: itself sprawled like a great metropolis along the lands above the large
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: central lake of Daem, Lake Umquam Renatusum, which was close beside the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaur outpost where we had narrowly escaped discovery and capture.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: However deficient in sight the forest was, it was abounding with sounds,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: everything from the call of the owl to groan of the bull frog, it was as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: if the whole of the forest had congregated about us, drawn to us by some
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unknown scent of interest and intrigue.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Continuing on for some time in the same way, I found myself growing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: weary, nodding my head slowly towards the oblivion of sleep, until I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: brought to an instant liveliness by Wagner's announcement that we had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reached our destination. I looked around carefully, yet I saw nothing at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all to indicate the entrance to a large, covert military establishment,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: much to my companions delight. Their whimsical sense of humor surfaced
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: once again as they laughed with seemingly infinite pleasure, both at my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wondering expression and with a sense of satisfaction at their own
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cleverness. After the outburst had been subdued and a certain level of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: solemnity had been reached, Wagner approached the nearest tree and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: knocked on it with a rhythmic rut-tut-tut.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Expecting their old trick to be replayed, I waited for the tree to open,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but to my surprise, it didn't, instead a strong rope ladder dropped down
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from a tree several yards to the east. This we climbed, and I found that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I had been mistaken as to the height of the ancient wooden towers, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they proved to be even loftier in dimensions than I had imagined.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Accordingly, it took us a good five minutes to reach its top at a quick
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and steady pace, and all through the climb I was terrified at the long
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: drop, from which the ladder offered no protections. Yet I made it to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: top safely, and found that there was a large platform built securely
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: among its upper branches, with enough room to hold a few dozen persons,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and there was even comfortable seating in the center. There were four
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: guards stationed on the platform, each equipped with a long bow and a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: quiver of metal tipped arrows, and though they were hardly visible
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through the dim light emitted from the covered lantern that lit the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: platform, I could see them quietly conversing with Wagner and Taurus
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: while Bernibus and myself reposed on the seats provided for that very
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: purpose.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: They conversed for awhile, though I could not hear them, nor could I see
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them well enough to judge their facial expressions, but Bernibus waylaid
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any anxious thoughts I had with his encouraging tone, and also by giving
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me a drought of ale and a loaf of bread to overcome my fatigue and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hunger, both of which I quickly consumed. He gave me more bread, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wouldn't allow me another glass of ale, for safety's sake. At first I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thought he deemed me easily overcome by spirits, but I soon discovered
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his reasons and thanked him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner returned from the guards and, finding that we were ready to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: proceed, led us to the far corner of the platform, where we were joined
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by Taurus. We then set off on a road that ran above the lower levels of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the canopy, made from jointed platforms that were attached to the
title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appeared to eye curiously.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: senses, which were depleted of vividness by the treacherous toils of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: proceeding day. Down, down, down went the stairs, until at length we
title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the upper wall, in which were stationed groups of archers, and though
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they now stood in a solemn, dignified manner, any opposition that
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: attempted to force a way through would have been decimated. Yet they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stood at attention and made no noise or movement at our passing, instead
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being the essence of well disciplined soldiery.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stretching upwards in such a fashion that it brought to mind images of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: on either side, ready at any moment to come crashing down upon them,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their lives in the hands of another. So did I then feel, the Canitaur
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: guards being able to slay me on the slightest whim of fancy that struck
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their minds into a sadistic mood. Yet I was not afraid, instead I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: overcome by a feeling of relaxation, where all cares and worries are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: fact, harmful to the mind.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The defile, or narrow passage, led to a great abyss, crossable only by a
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: drawbridge controlled on the other side, which was at this time lowered
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and ready for us to cross, which we did, accompanied by four honor
title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: discussions and debates, via another winding stairway that took us even
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: further below the surface. It was a splendid room, equipped with all
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: circle around a central stage with a podium upon it. Seats were arranged
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being allotted to each of the members of the council and his aide de
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: camps; there were two hundred such clusters. Sitting there like they had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: and untidy, a rare state for a Canitaur to be in, with their clothes

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ruffled, their hair uncombed, and their eyes glazed with a discordant
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: state of mind.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner, who turned out to be a high official among them, led me to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: top of the stage where the podium was, with a sofa, desk, and several
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: walls that formed the base of the podium, creating a small, private
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anteroom for those at the podium. I laid myself down tiredly on the sofa
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to rest while Wagner took the stage and began to speak.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Friends, comrades, associates," he said to the council, "I thank you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for neglecting your beds at this late hour to join with us here in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Hall of Meeting, for there is something very important to be shared. You
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: are all no doubt familiar with the ancient prophecy of the Externus
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Miraculum: long ago it was told that in our extreme need, when hope no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: longer exists in the hearts of many, an ancient would be sent by Onan
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our lord to redeem and deliver us from the evils of this world, for as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our doom was wrought in their times, so would our hope originate. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: past cannot be changed except by those who first made it, and our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: present is dictated by the happenings of the past, so that for a better
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: future the past must be changed, and only then will we be freed from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: burdens of history."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He continued, "We have therefore long awaited the arrival of our kinsman
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: redeemer, who will change the past and prevent the cause of our current
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: woes from happening, for without its roots, what evil can grow and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: flourish? Our redeemer was to come on the Kootch Patah, when our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: adversaries the Zards are not watchful, being drunk with celebrations at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the turning of the year. Myself, Taurus and Bernibus went to the shores
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of Lake Umquam Renatusum, as is our custom, to watch for the coming of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the promised one, and this time we were not disappointed, for he came to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: us, even as the prophecy says, as we sat hidden in the living tower.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Seen by the Zards, we were almost discovered, until the promise of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hidden fortress drew them away, even as the prophecy says. And now we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: are here, delegates of the Canitaurian people, safely within our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fortress with our kinsman redeemer, so what shall be done? Let us
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: decide."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: At this point he cast a glance towards me, as if desiring me to speak
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before the council, but I was in the last throes of wakefulness, where
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sleep has crept so far upon you that arrival in the land of dreams is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only a matter of moments, and wakefulness is not desired, nor is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anything else. I looked at him with my eyes glazed with that sweet,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: savory taste of sleep, and though I was conscious, I was not in control,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only an audience to actions of my subconscious whims, and even that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: passed beyond my reach as my eyes fell shut, isolating me in the realm
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: where worldly concerns mean nothing. And so I was when my exhaustion
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: overtook me, leaving me sound asleep on the sofa behind the podium.

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: room where I was laid on a bed, the room being located, as I found out
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: later, not too far from the Hall of Meeting. Though the depth of the
title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: afternoon by that strange internal clock that so seldom errs. It was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: correct, as usual. There was a quaint fireplace on the far wall of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and avoiding all the while the clutter brought by superfluous material
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: possessions. A table in the center of the room was furnished with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: steaming meal, beside which sat my new friend Bernibus, smiling on me
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with a benevolent and almost paternal affection.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Good morning, Jehu," he said, "Or should I say afternoon, for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: morning has quite passed by already."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, and it has left in me a great appetite, my good man."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "As is shown clearly in your eyes," he jested, "Come and eat."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Needing no further urging, I leapt from my bed, sat down across from him
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: at the table, and began partaking greedily of the hearty breakfast of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hash browns and pancakes, which were pleasing to my mouth and stomach,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for the tastes in food are controlled more by the condition of the body
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than by the time of day. When I had satisfied my needs, we reclined in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our chairs and began conversing:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Tell me," I said, "Did my untimely slumber yester eve cause any
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: irritated prides?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Quite to the contrary, the council was well humored and followed your
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lead to their bed chambers."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am relieved to hear it, for I was anxious of appearing lax in ardor
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: or animation."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Not so, my friend, you are quite exonerated from doubtful thoughts.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There is a session planned for this evening though, so may yet feel
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: yourself put on trial."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Unfortunate," said I, "But surely they can mean no harm, am I not the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: kinsman redeemer, after all?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, you are," Bernibus said with a look of subdued apprehension, "We
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: have an end in view, though the means are as yet not wholly decided. It
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is a complicated situation."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I smiled softly, "So is always the case."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "In truth it is: time reveals all things yet do all things reveal time?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What do you mean?" I asked him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Our situation is complicated by differing views of time, and I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wondering aloud if history and the present reality disclose the truth
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: about time in the same way that time reveals the truth of the present.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: If our way were more illuminated, the journey would be easier."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Perhaps that is why men look to the well lit paths of history, or to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the dim conjectures of the future rather than the dark, yet detailed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ways of present."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Perhaps," he said, "But the present is so fleeting that it holds little
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: intrigue."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Even so, it is the stage, not still waiting behind the curtain, nor
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: already performed."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yet the past controls by influences and prejudices, justified or not,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and it will doubtless be the view of the council that the past must be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: redone, that the problems be addressed at the source," Bernibus replied.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am still in the dark about all your inferences," I said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "My apologies, I forget myself. But let us not dwell on subjects which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: may become quite exhausted in the near future, for better or worse," he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: told me.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: on the opportunity to steer it in a different direction, "I know little
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "There isn't much to tell," he coyly responded.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: imitating some mythological god's wrath.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He smiled discreetly and yielded to my request, "Very well, I will tell
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you. I was born in the year 490 D.V. (that is, Durante Vita), to a poor
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: couple from the northernmost pier of Daem, the Gog."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Wait a moment, Bernibus," I interrupted, "I didn't mean in that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fashion, for when I say I know little of you, it is because I literally
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: know little of 'you', not the circumstances that make up your past. I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: guess it goes back to the interpretation of the past and its powers, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: since we can't seem to escape discussing it, lets embrace it willingly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: You seem to believe that the events of your life have shaped you in such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a profound way that their mere description is sufficient to explain your
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: personality; I will grant that their influence has effected you subtly,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but history is not the scapegoat of the present. The circumstances do
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: more to define the character of an individual than to shape it, for even
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: siblings with the exact same experiences can be greatly different in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: personality and achievements. But what I mean is this: your past has
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: influenced your present, yet it is gone and your present remains, show
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me Bernibus, not his previous forms."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: You, who are now reading this, may think this statement of mine to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus to be hypocritical, in light of the very purpose and intent of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: these memoirs. You may be thinking that I am relating this whole
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happening in order to justify my actions and decisions. But that is not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the case, for I understand that you have no power over me, I have long
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: been dead in your present and your sentiments mean naught to me. In

text: the future. You will understand that statement later on, but for now let

text: of Bernibus, whereas I wish to impart to you my story, though ere its

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: end you may come also to know me. I have no ambitions of material
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: immortality.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus understood my meaning, and though he disagreed with its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: theoretical imputations, he humored me and did as I suggested. He pulled
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: back his brow in a reflective demeanor, brought his eyes to mine and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: began:

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: myself. I suppose you mean that we discourse on some variety of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rather than be given mine, and instead of my telling you what I would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like to think I am, you would see what I am in truth. Strange, isn't it,

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I am and be horrified at the truth."

text: him there is no such thing as love, only business, the destruction of

text: the Zards at any cost. No price is too high," he told me with almost a
