text: "Not at all, I do sympathize, however, with peaceful solutions," he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Which is why Wagner disapproves of you, no doubt."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, mainly, but don't misunderstand me. I am not a closet Futurist,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nor am I a strict pacifist, I just can't help feeling that there is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: another way. But I understand the selection of ideologies, how the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stronger breaks the weaker to submission, and while one flourishes, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: other diminishes, and I understand focus points, but I cannot justify
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their marriage."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What you mean by focus points?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "They are the culmination of conflict, where two sides meet and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: battle takes place, not meaning necessarily an important or strategic
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: military, civil, or commercial place, but one on which the fighting
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: occurs, the result ending in the defeat or victory of the whole
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: campaign. The focus point of the Zards and the Canitaurs exists both on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the philosophical and martial levels. On the philosophical level, it is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the question as to what is the proper solution for remedying our current
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: catastrophic situation. On one side the Pastites wish to correct the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: root of the problem by stopping its realization in the past, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Futurists, however, would venture into the future and brings its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stabilization and completion back. On the military level, our forces
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: collide in the forests around Lake Umquam Renatusum, the northern
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mountains belonging to us and the southern plains to them. The lake
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: itself is of little importance, yet whoever conquers it will conquer
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Interesting," I said, "But I do not understand how you seem to imply
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that I am your ancestor, while Onan seemed to mean the opposite, that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you are my ancestors."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It is strange and complex, and we understand very little of it,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ourselves. The time for the council has come though, for our talk has
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dwindled away the afternoon. Perhaps some of your questions will there
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: be answered. But come, let us go."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very well," I said, "Take me to your leaders."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: From that room, the one I had awoken in, it wasn't very far to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: council room. Exiting it, we turned down a short, closed hallway that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: opened into the concealed area behind the podium that I spoke of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: earlier. On the sofa where I had fallen asleep was seated Wagner and on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a circle of smaller chairs around the edges of the area were seated
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: about ten stately looking Canitaurs, clean and well dressed, according
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to their customs. They greeted me amorously, with a mixture of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: eagerness, excitement, and hope painted on their purloined countenances,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: taken from the sleepless spirits of several departed generations of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: war-hardened veterans.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Standing as we entered, they greeted me cordially, and, once the formal
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: greeting of a short bow and a blessing was finished, we all sat down,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they in their previous seats, I next to Wagner, and Bernibus in a small
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: chair in the corner, away from the circle of the delegates. He, that is,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner, then opened our dialog:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Welcome to the council, Jehu," he said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I was under the impression that the council was much larger," I replied
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: candidly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It is, but this is the leadership; we felt that the clamors of a full
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: legislature would be overwhelming to you at first. I know it still
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: overwhelms me sometimes," he laughed, and the others with him. That
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: explanation sufficed at the time, but I later found that Wagner had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: taken control of the council himself, and that it had no real power: it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: never met for more than ceremonial matters, the Khedive Kibitzer,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner, controlling the rest. But I get ahead of myself.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: One of the others then interjected, "Our purpose now, Jehu, is not so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: much to make decisions as to inform you of the decisions we have already
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: made, not that we mean to exclude you from our counsels, but we've been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: preparing for this moment, your arrival, for many years, since it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: foretold long ago."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Decisions with what end?" I asked of them.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The reestablishing of an efficient and healthy climate, both naturally
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and philosophically, one in which tradition, history, and experience
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reign supreme," Wagner said in such a way that I couldn't help but think
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that it had served as an idiom of his for many years.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "A termination of the Zardovian conflict, then?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Essentially, but not wholly, as there are other, more complicated ends
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in view, less integrated with the format of a completely ideological
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conflict."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Meaning?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Meaning that we wish to return to our original forms," Wagner said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Those being, I assume, the same as my own."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, you see after the Great War, the atmosphere was so filled with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: radioactive materials that all life was destroyed, except for that on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Daem, which was protected because of our distant and isolated location,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the presence of a group of insects that neutralize radiation. They
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were overwhelmed in the first few decades, for though they were able to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reduce the amount to make it habitable, we degenerated into what we are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: now, Zards and Canitaurs, based on our habitats, we being mountainous,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forest dwelling folk, and they plains people. At first our ancestors
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: grew to immense proportions, as did the vegetation on Daem, but we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: slowly returned to normal size as the radioactive material was consumed.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I am surprised that Onan did not tell you about it all," he said,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: looking at me with a slight tinge of confusion creeping into his wayward
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: eyes, formerly filled only with hope and excitement.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I wish he would have," I responded, "But he said that it was against
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the rules."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Ah, yes, I forgot about the rules there for a moment," he laughed, his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: countenance returning to its former gleeful appearance.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "A foolish law, no doubt, and from whom?" I said, availing of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: apparent intra-personal deja vu, that is, the converging of the presents
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of our two minds into one idea, between Wagner and myself to cultivate a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: bit of sympathy in my difficult situation. But there would be no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: harvest, for Wagner checked his mirth and said:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It was necessary, and the Council of the Gods did well to govern
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: themselves more strictly."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "How so?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Well, during the Homeric period the gods really went at it, using
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: humanity as players in their battles, like a game of chess, actually.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Come to think of it, chess did originate in the realm of the gods after
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the laws. Things were quite a mess back then, though, with a whole horde
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of demi-gods walking the earth, and it ended up snuffing out the first
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: flames of democracy and leaving monarchies for the longest time."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Homer's stories were true, then?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very much so, but after the laws of physical abstinence were adopted
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: things mellowed out considerably, and men went back to their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: self-obsession, their material minds weren't yet weaned from the physical
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: realm."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "So the very men who claimed mental superiority because they were free
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from superstitions and divine disillusionment were themselves victims of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their own sophism, and while they thought themselves crowned with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enlightenment, it was naught but the Phrygian caps of their prejudices
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: toward the material state?" I asked, with more than the average dose of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: irony and feeling, both for my subjects and myself.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Exactly, upon disinterested examination one finds the theater of human
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: history to be one defined by a ludicrous melodramaticy, the soap opera
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the gods," he answered. "But we digress far from our point, Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which is a discussion concerning the implementation of our plans of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: action formed in preparation of our current situation."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "So I had surmised," I smiled at the reminder, "But tell me, what are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your plans, and what is the current situation?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "This is a time of fulfillment, with the events of many of our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prophecies coming to pass. Now is a time of action and of hope. You, our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: kinsman redeemer, have come, and the time is ripe for victory and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: domination, ripe, in short, for a return to natural existence, harmony
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: between forces interior and exterior. Our plan, my dear Jehu, is to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: attack the Zards swiftly and fiercely and break their strongholds like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the walls of Jericho, literally."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It sounds daring, certainly," I said, "But is it not overly so? I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: under the impression that the Zards were much superior in force than the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaurs."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "In the southern regions, where you landed, yes, they are, but we rule
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the northern sphere of action. Our forces actually form a soft
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: equilibrium that keeps fate's pendulum from straying from its neutral
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: position, so that a military action previously would not have been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: predictable, with either side being capable of winning. Under such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conditions war is avoided, but now you have arrived. The Zards, as well
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as ourselves, have been expecting a kinsman redeemer, you see, and our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: war has been kept from raging by the belief of each side that their god
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would propel them to victory with certainty by the sending of one such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as yourself. Your arrival changes things, it marks the beginning of our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dominance," he told me vaingloriously.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The muted felicity I have witnessed about my arrival is explained,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: then," I ventured, "Excitement that the end is near and victory close at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hand, yet that feeling subdued by the realization that a period of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: deeper darkness must first be gone through."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Your words are true," Wagner replied, "And yet I have a great
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: confidence in our plans, which have been matured through many years of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: careful deliberation. As the time will never be more ready than at the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: present, in the present we must act."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What is your plan, then?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It is calculated to end in the conquering of the Zards, and as such,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only an unexpected and unrelenting attack at the very heart of their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: strength will succeed. Anything less will only bring them to a full
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: alert, and then any battle will have to be drawn out with excessive
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: casualties on both sides. Therefore, we have decided upon an attack on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Nunami, their capital city and main strength, being the center and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: majority of both their population and economy. Yet an outright siege of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the city is impossible for those very reasons, it being so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: self-contained that it can resist bitterly, and its military is so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: clustered that it can be brought into action almost instantly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Considering those problems, it was deemed necessary to draw the Zards
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: away from the city and destroy it in their absence, so that they are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: left destitute of the means of war and sustenance, and rendered weak. To
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: do this, we have spent the last several years stockpiling huge
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: quantities of liquid fervidus flamma, an extremely combustible
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: substance. It is stored in an underground reservoir in the foothills of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the mountains, connected via aqueduct to Lake Umquam Renatusum. When the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: time is ripe, we will empty it into the lake and set it aflame, and our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: calculations show the flames reaching a height of five miles for a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: length of six hours, which should be enough to gain the Zard's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: preponderance," Wagner explained.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But wouldn't it catch the forest on fire and burn down your whole
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: empire in the process?" I asked, alarmed at his apparent lack of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: vigilance.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "We have been treating the trees on a ten mile radius with an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anti-flammatory solution for several years as well, and it is quite
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: impossible to set them on fire."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Which explains why you dared to have a fire pit in the trunk of a tree
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: outpost."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes," he laughed, "We aren't so foolhardy as we may seem. Appearances
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: can be deceiving."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The exodus of the Zards from Nunami is almost guaranteed by the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mortal's natural curiosity and delight in the calamities of others," I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: said, "But how do you plan on leveling the town before the remnant raise
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the alarm and the mass of the people return?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Atomic anionizers," he returned.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Which are what? They sound like they are beyond my level of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: understanding."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Not at all," Wagner told me, "Do not be fooled by the technically
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: complex sounding name. An atom is the smallest form into which matter
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: can be broken down into while still retaining its identity, and an anion
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is a positively charged ion, or in other words, an instance of an atom
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in which there are more electrons than protons, resulting in a charge of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: negative electricity. An atomic anionizer is just what its name would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: imply: a device that morphs normal atoms into atoms with an extreme
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: negative charge by emitting massive amounts, to the tune of many
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: millions of moles, of solitary electrons into the air through a bombing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: device."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He went on, explaining the consequences of the weapon, "An atom, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: therefore all matter, which is made up of atoms, is engaged in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: constant revolution around the nucleus, in the same way in which our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: solar system revolves around our sun, and our sun around the black hole
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in the center of the galaxy. This revolving motion is the basis for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: formation of all matter that we know of, both in its smallest form, like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the atom, or its larger forms, like the galaxy. The electrons emitted
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from the atomic anionizer are drawn into an orbit around the nuclei of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the atoms of all the matter near which they are detonated, much like the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: way planets catch satellites and space debris into revolving rings
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around them. This addition of electrons gives the atoms such a powerful
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: negative charge that the poles of the atom, which regulate its rotations
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in much the same way that the earth's axis, or poles, regulate its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rotations, are thrown from their natural equilibrium, causing the poles
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to reverse. This, in turn, changes the direction in which the atoms
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rotate, and in the brief instant in which the force of the revolving
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: movement, or gravity, is not strong enough to retain the atom's shape,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it lapses, bringing the materials they make up crashing down in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: disarray.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "We will plant some of these 'atomic bombs' inside the city of Nunami,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and when they go off, the buildings themselves will implode and tumble
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to the ground. One hand-sized capsule can easily level almost ten square
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: miles, and we have enough of them to bring the Zards to their knees,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with plenty to spare for any circumstance."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Wouldn't the bombs kill those who set them off, though?" I asked him
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anxiously.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "We have electron deflecting suits that negate the effects of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anionizers."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I'm glad to hear it."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "And well you should be," he grinned, which, as out of place as it would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: seem, looked completely natural on his countenance, "For you and I shall
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: be among the bombers. Our meeting must end here, though, my dear Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for we each have things to attend to in preparation for the attack on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Nunami. I will see you soon, until then, farewell."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Farewell, Wagner," I replied, and we each stood and bowed as we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prepared to depart, each to our own occupations.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: With that our council ended, and, in the company of Bernibus, I was sent
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to another area of the fortress to be measured for an anti-electron
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: suit, in order to protect me from the effects of reverse revolution. We
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: didn't converse in the beginning of our walk, for my mind was too busy
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: subconsciously thinking over what Wagner had said to have any conscious
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: meditations.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We walked through the fortress towards the northern section, which held
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the technological rooms, so as to get an anti-electron suit in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: making for myself. Realizing that the fortress has been little
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: described, I will do so now. It was broken into six different
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sub-divisions, each branching from the only entrance, which was in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: center of them all, the different divisions connecting to it through
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: long, narrow defiles, or gorges, like the one at the entrance. This was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for security, each area being independently contained within the whole.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The six areas, or departments, as they were called, were as follows: the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Northern was the technological and industrial research and production
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: facilities; the Eastern was the residential department, containing also
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the civil services, such as medical care and distribution centers; the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Southern was the agricultural and other food production areas, though
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there was little besides agricultural, for the Canitaurs were strict
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: vegetarians; the Western was for mining minerals and other raw materials
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to be used by the other departments. The other two departments were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: below the others, being differentiated between by the names Left and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Right, the Left being the governmental offices, and the Right the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: military headquarters, providing protections both civil and foreign
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: (this was, incidentally, the beginning of the expression of the terms
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Left and Right to denote ideological preferences, but I digress).
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Uniform in all the fortress was the architecture, it being a strange mix
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: between elegant and gentle arches and curves and brute practicality, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: while the ceilings were high and open, and the walls wide, they were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rendered homely by their plain surfaces and the absence of small
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: triflings, conditions that were necessitated because of its identity: an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: impregnable fortress containing a highly organized and self-sufficient
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: governmental society, each citizen having a particular duty for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: common good, and each kept from an unfarcical personal identity by the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: means of a statist society.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: From the lower, governmental offices we went up a flight of stairs that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wrapped round and round a tower-like tunnel, and soon reached the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: departmental portal. Once there, we took the northern tunnel, which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: opened into a large hall that stretched on almost endlessly, with hordes
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of tunnels branching off to the various agencies. There were a great
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: many Canitaurs working busily, preparing for the attack on Nunami and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its possible results, which, though long prepared for, had a few last
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moment components to be finished. Walking down the central through way,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we went to the far end of the hall, which, as it was a walk of at least
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: two miles, afforded plenty of time for observation and reflecting, two
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: things that I am naturally given to. Accordingly, I turned to my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: companion, Bernibus, and offered in an almost philosophical way:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Your society seems to be flourishing, though I am not surprised, as you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all seem vigorously industrious. I am amazed, however, that no one
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shirks from their job, no matter how menial or trifling."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "We all have our assigned jobs, and all know that one slovenly job may
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cost us dearly," he said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I suppose I am prejudiced by my conceptions of personal liberty, but it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is contrary to my conscience that the state should have more duty than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to enforce the individual liberties by common force."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But we are at war, and we must do as we do, or be trampled underfoot."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "If all states went no further than justice permits, namely the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: protection by common force the rights of individuality, liberty, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: property, than there would be no room for conflict between states, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hence, no war."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yet it is our ideologies that bring war, besides, do not the ends
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: justify the means?" he asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Your ideologies may cause conflict, yet it seems that your behemoth
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: states facilitate it into war. About the ends and the means, I don't
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: know: I am no philosopher," I answered.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I sighed and was silent for a moment as we walked along, then, after a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moment or so, I said quietly to myself, "I'm not much of a kinsman
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: redeemer, either."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We continued on through the hall without further conversation, and I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: paid little attention to my surroundings, so that while my eyes saw and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: my mind displayed, my subconscious was not present in the effort, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thereby no memory was retained. This may seem to be the plot of an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unimaginative writer to escape the use of that faculty, but as these are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nothing but my written memories, and I make no claims of producing good
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fiction, I will leave that hall primarily to the minds of the reader.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Soon after, we arrived at our destination, which was very nearly at the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: end of the hall, and entered to find that we were expected and a space
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: open for my fitting, which was soon accomplished, and my suit promised
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to be at my quarters the next morning. That would be just in time for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the departure of the raiding party, which was set to cut out and embark
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for Nunami a little after that, in order to be in place in the hidden
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: treetop posts surrounding the city before nighttime, as the operation
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was to begin at midnight. At first I thought that the attack was pushed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forward in haste, but as I came to realize that my coming had been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prophesied and a great amount of time had been spent preparing for this
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: day, it seemed only natural that they should want to bring the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hostilities to a close after such a long time. There were other
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: considerations as well. The weather, for one, had to be dry and not at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all windy for the fire to be safely attempted, and also the possibility
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the Zards making the first offensive could not be ignored, for they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had knowledge of my arrival and may have felt forced to act to prevent
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the very type of thing that we were about to attempt.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 7: Down to Nunami
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When I awoke the next morning I found Bernibus and Wagner conversing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: quietly in the corner of my bed chambers, and as I first opened my eyes
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I saw Wagner looking at me with a blank, glazed expression, while
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus' was one of apprehension, apparently on my behalf. It seemed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: odd to me, but as Wagner became livid again quickly after his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: split-second lapse and gave me a hearty "Good morning", I thought
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nothing more of it. After his greeting, he continued:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The day is ripe for victory, my friend, and the time is come for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: battle. We both have some preparations to complete, and so must
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: separate, but we will meet again at noon in the entrance hall. Farewell
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: until then," and with that he quit the room.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I looked at Bernibus, yet before either of us could speak, we heard a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: low, hollow grumbling, like the shaking of some building or foundation.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He looked in my direction for a moment with an alarmed countenance,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before I said defensively, "Tis but my stomach."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Then we must get you some victuals," he laughed, "And I have just the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thing to satisfy you and keep you so for a day or more: some mirus. It
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is our traditional energy food, for though its taste is bitter, its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: after-life is pleasant."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "And what is food except a servant to the body?" I said, "Let us eat."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very well," he replied.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: And eat we did, for it was brought by a food service Canitaur on a tray,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and I was surprised to see that it was a mixture of broccoli, spinach,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and mushrooms, with a flavorless, glowing sauce. He was right,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: incidentally, for it was both bitter before and pleasant after its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: consumption.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I know of the solids, but what is this sauce?" I asked of him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Carbon," he replied.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I looked at him and questioned, "Pure carbon? I have never heard of its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: having this use before."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Your civilization was long ago and had not developed it yet."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "That has perplexed me, now that you mention it," I said, "Onan seemed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to mean that I was going back in time to help my ancestors, but you say
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that I went forward, that I am one of the ancients."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He was wary for a moment, though if it was because of the apparent
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conflict, or because I was on a first name basis with his god I couldn't
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tell. He soon recovered his countenance and said, "It is a complicated
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: question, and I believe you should ask Wagner the next time you see him,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: after the raid though, of course. The time of departure is nigh now,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: however, so you should put on your anti-electron suit," he said as he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: picked it up from the corner and brought it to me.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It was a subtle dark brown and looked more like a normal suit of clothes
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than an electron reflecting suit, but then again, I thought, why would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it be a strange looking apparatus? Why would an advanced technological
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: age necessarily be devoid of any sense of fashion, although that would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: be assuming that any civilization had ever had one. Fashion is more a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: characterization of a culture than a basic and unchanging principle, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a desert people would wear clothes that would be most uncomfortable to a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: people who lived in the snow. Clothes may not make the man, but the man
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: certainly makes the clothes, and you can judge a person by what they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wear so far as it is in their power to decide what that is.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: After putting on the suit I found that it fit perfectly, and above that,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I found it to be very comfortable, including the head piece, which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: formed closely around the skull and was not at all noticeable or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: obscuring. In fact, as it was made of a plasma that allowed everything
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through except lone particles, it was so uninhibiting that a moment
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: after I had put mine on I had completely forgotten about it. The only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: other part of the suit that stood out at all was the long, metallic
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: buckle that secured the belt, it having a bowie knife hidden within it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in an unnoticeable and inconspicuous manner. Bernibus had put on his as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I had put on mine, and as I looked away from the mirror that was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: opposite the door, I saw him dressed the same as myself, yet because the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: suit so blended with his fur, it was hard to tell which ended where.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Finding that we were both ready, we repaired to the entrance hall. Along
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the way I asked Bernibus of his wife, Wagner's sister, of whom I had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: heard little and seen nothing. He was quiet for a pause, and then said:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "She was an angel, what else can be said?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Was?" I asked hesitantly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, she was killed by the Zards on a border raid, as we were at that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: time living apart from the Canitaur mass with a few friends. She was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: less aggressive than her brother, and, much to his disapprobation, we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lived with a group of separatists, believing that war, physical
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conflict, is never the right answer to ideological conflict. Wagner
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: excommunicated us in his anger, though his sister was very dear to him,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and after she died he was struck with remorse and made me his deputy
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Kibitzer. He felt that it would somehow do her honor, as it would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: recognize us as having been married and make me his brother-in-law,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which is an important relationship traditionally, as he has no other
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: siblings. So here I am, technically second-in-command, but because of my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: soft lining, I have no real command."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You would not attack Nunami, then?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He chose his words carefully, saying, "More pain will not negate the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pain already in existence, yet war is not always avoidable, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sometimes it is even necessary."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When we reached the entrance hall, where the raiding party was to meet,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we found that there was already assembled a majority of the force,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: including Wagner. The party was only twenty strong, as the atomic
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anionizers were to do the main work and the planned raid required
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stealth and secrecy, not force or might. Within a quarter of an hour all
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the stragglers had arrived and all the anionizers were accounted for, so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner gave a short debriefing to ensure that all the members were on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the same page. We were to sneak into the city when the populous was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: distracted by the fire on Lake Umquam Renatusum, which was to be started
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: at midnight. We would plant the atomic anionizers at the right spacing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: so as to bring down the whole city once we were escaped, using the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: remote control provided for that very purpose. The suits would protect
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: us from the blasts, and, as a precaution, the remote had an automatic
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: five second delay between being pressed and exploding the bombs, though
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it was more for form than practicality. After he finished we set off,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being arranged two abreast per row, there being ten rows. Bernibus and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: myself were partners, for we had become close friends in the few days
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that I had spent among the Canitaurs, while Wagner was once again the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: leading guide and Taurus the rearguard.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: After crossing the chasm that separated the hall and the entrance
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tunnel, we came to the long defile that formed the latter and passed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through it swiftly, the lofty archer guards remaining as stern and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: immovable as when I had first come through. We then came to the winding
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stairs that occupied the hollowed innards of a massive and ancient tree,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of which kind many were to be found in Daem, being at least fifty feet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thick and 700 feet high, such gigantic trees that were never seen
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: elsewhere, yet constituted the whole forests of the northern lands. I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: found that the stairs were as long as I had remembered, taking us a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great while to ascend to the top of the tree, and when we had made it,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we, especially myself, were dazzled by the effulgent light of midday.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: After having been out of the sun's reach for the last few days I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: completely unprepared, though the shock helped me by curing me of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: disillusionment that comes from not seeing sun, moon, or stars for any
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: length of time. Taking a rest for a few moments on the seats on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: platform, we collected our strength. After our brief repose was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: completed, we set off again with renewed vigor across the treeway on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which I had first come to the Canitaur's fortress. You will remember
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that the road was made by the securing of five or six foot platforms to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the intertwined branches of those great trees, over which one could
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: travel with ease and be safe from exposure to those below by the thick
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: foliage that grew on the trees and was carefully manicured for that very
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: purpose.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Soon we reached the first platform I had seen, which we had come upon
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from below, but we did not descend there, instead keeping on by the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: treeway in the direction from which we had come that night, that being
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: southward, towards the lake, the savanna, and the Zardovian capital,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Nunami. The air was warm, with a slight breeze as we went along, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that, mixed with the plentiful flora about us and the songs of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: treetop dwellers, rendered the whole feeling of the walk peaceful and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happy, though its end was not to be such. I soon forgot the worldly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: concerns that plagued me as I was soaking in the simplicity of nature,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not a simplicity of form, for all things are incomprehensively complex,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but simplicity of meaning.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: After a time I began noticing changes in our surroundings that indicated
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we were drawing nearer to our goal, namely, the trees lessening in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: proportions, the terrain becoming flatter, and the air growing moister
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and more vibrant. Still, the trees continued to spring up from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ground like great earthen tentacles, for while their size diminished, it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was not by enough to change their demeanor, the trees anywhere on Daem
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being great in size.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The sun journeyed with us, and by the time we reached Lake Umquam
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Renatusum, twilight's last agony was being performed in the heavenly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: theater, and the rippling waters mirrored it, adding only a strange,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: flowing texture. The lake's current caught my eye with its subtle
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: oddity, for it was amiss and it appeared upon close inspection that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there was an undertow, as if there was an underground river flowing into
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the lake and bringing about its swirling currents.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus saw me looking down at the waters from the lofty road with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: puzzled look, and asked me if I was wondering about the water's current.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being pumped into the lake through the underground aqueducts, which, of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: course, was for the purpose of igniting it to decoy for our raid. Once
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it was explained it made sense, yet I looked at it anyway, for it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: still a gorgeous and inspiring view.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We were moving quickly, however, and it soon was out of sight, and I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: again turned towards our destination with apprehensions of failure. They
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: seemed to place great faith in my presence, as the emissary of Onan, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: while I was, I was also Jehu, and I wasn't confident with my own
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: abilities. But it was upon those the situation mostly rested, it being
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the resolve of the gods after the Homeric period to take a more removed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: role in the lives of men. I wonder how many from my own times were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: divine agents, for better or worse. Either way, my main concern then was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: making the correct decisions, for I rightly believed that my involvement
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would decide the matter, although not in the manner I had anticipated.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As I looked about myself to reconnoiter the feelings of my comrades I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was fruitless, for they all wore impermeable countenances, though that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was itself an indicator of their resolve.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Within an hour after the fall of darkness we reached the outskirts of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Nunami, or rather, its edge, for it was walled in with massive stone
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: walls and battlements, with a sturdy gate of twenty foot width being
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: placed at the northern, southern, eastern, and western ends. The trees
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hung right over the walls, and as such we were able to take positions
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from which we could descend into the city when the time to do so came.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Yet we were still rendered invisible by the thick foliage.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Night's zenith blew in slowly on the wind like the belabored breaths of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a dying man, and after a period of worry, it came: midnight, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appointed hour. No sooner had the moon reached its utmost height,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shrouding the lands in a shadowless vortex, than a great blaze erupted
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from the northern lands, and it rose almost instantly to its estimated
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: height of five miles. It was a terrible sight to behold, for any flame
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is a captivating display of inorganic life, but a pillar of flame
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: several miles high is more than just an enlarged specimen, for it plays
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: host to a great horde of phantasmal apparitions that wrestle ferociously
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with one another. As the flame shot upwards it cast a great light down
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: on everything that rivaled the illumination of midday. At first I feared
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lest the light should show our silhouettes to the Zards, as we were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: between them and it, but it did not, or at least they took no notice of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it if it did, for we were quite undetected in our hiding place.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Our worries were far from over though, for now came the crucial point in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our plans: in order for our small force to infiltrate the city and place
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the atomic anionizers, the Zards must not only have been distracted and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: preoccupied with the blaze, but they had also to leave the city almost
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: empty and go to the lake itself, for if a cry was raised, or any
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: substantial resistance attempted, the complex procedures to detonate the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anionizers properly, so as to level the city but not the surrounding
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: country, may have been hindered. There were several factors on our side
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: though, the element of surprise being the foremost, for in their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: excitement the Zardovian resistance would likely mistake us for a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: regular sized army and flee in fear at our supposed superiority,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: especially since the presence of me, the kinsman redeemer, was known to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Zards. Also, the Zards were known to be curious and careless and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ruled by the desire for excitement, meaning that if an entertaining
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: undertaking was possible, they would pursue it, no matter how dangerous
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: or ill-advised.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Within a moment after the flame was lit, all of the Zards outside, which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were many, were gazing with silent wonder at it, and in the second
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: But the third moment witnessed a drastic change in their behavior, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their initial bewilderment wore off and suddenly, with a united prelude
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the drawing in of a breath, they all began speaking at once,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: resulting in a clamorous din that lasted for a few moments, before
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: things hushed again and we could hear a few individual voices discussing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: loudly. Though we couldn't make out their exact words, they were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: apparently conferring with one another about what action to take. Our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: breathing became slow and heavy and our brows were knit tensely, for we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: knew that the fate of our mission rested on what they did then, whether
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: or not the long planned decoy would work.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It was an anxious moment, and one with a heavy burden attached to it.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Fortunately, though, as our fate was decided, it was done so in our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: favor, for the Zards began exiting the city in a great multitude of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scales that swept along the savanna like a tidal wave over a sandy
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: coast. They came out fast and strong, and through each of the four
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: gates, though only the northern was fully visible to us, the others
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being too far to be seen distinctly. Still, we could see them rushing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: out of Nunami at a quick pace, not hurried, as if frightened or finicky,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nor slow as in deliberation and meditation, instead it was a steady trot
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that they took, allowing them to move safely and swiftly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The tide of Zards swept steadily past us, and it was a good half an hour
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: later that the final ones had left the gates and the city far behind.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Most had taken some type of weapon, a pitchfork or club or occasionally
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a sword, for the threat of war was a constant, but none of them had any
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: idea that their only danger was behind them. It was not all in the clear

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: doubt, that the laurels were to be won there and not at Nunami, and as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: such, they paid little heed to the walls, instead walking with their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: necks craned precariously to the north.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We were able to jump unto the wall silently from our concealed roost on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the treeway when the nearest patrol had passed by. From there we went
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: along the wall a short way until we came to a battlement, there taking
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the downward leading steps that brought us to the ground. Once there we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were pleased and hopeful at what we saw: everything was abandoned, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: no Zards were in sight save those on the walls, whose gaze was cast
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: elsewhere. We set to work, then, according to our preset plan, which was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to break up into groups of two and cover the city with our atomic
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: anionizers, so as to spread the destruction as evenly as possible.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner and myself were partners, and we took the central district, near
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the government's center, the palace, and the Temple of Time, which rose
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: above the city like a great tree amidst a desert. It was, in fact, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: very structure that had so stood out to me during my journey through the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prairie upon my arrival, and once again its sobering sensation struck
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me, and I found myself staring up at its top, a full 800 feet high, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: bottom being an ornate and elaborate temple. The middle, which supplied
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: most of its height, was a long, round tower, and at top there was a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spherical pinnacle which had what looked to be a room in it.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner soon called my attention back to our work, and we busied
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ourselves with planting a bomb at the base of the palace, using a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: smaller type anionizer, which, I noticed, was set just right so that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: while all of Nunami would be leveled, the temple with its great tower
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would be beyond the impact and left standing. Just as we had set it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: correctly, we heard a high-pitched whistle, which was the preconcerted
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: directly and saw its reason: a squadron of Zards had been garrisoned
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: being preoccupied with business and not seeing the flames. When he did
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: go to the window, he saw the fire, and rushed to see what was about, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instead of finding out, he ran into us, who were right outside the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: palace.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner dashed wildly through the streets in an impressive show of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dexterity, and did a wall-jump between two lofty buildings to gain the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wall. The others had done likewise, having been trained by a lifetime of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conflict to have nerves of lightning speed and earthly strength. Their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instincts had come in subconsciously when they had seen the cause of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: alarm and they escaped, without thinking of me in the critical moment. I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lacked such strength and speed of mind and was caught as soon as I had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: seen the squadron, aided, probably, by the fact that upon seeing me the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: king had become excited and rushed at me with great speed. When Wagner
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had first turned around and saw me their prisoner, he looked crestfallen
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and hopeless, for he had no way to rescue me. He held the remote control
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for the atomic anionizers in his hand and was about to set them off and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: make good the plan, but before he could, our eyes met for an instant,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and we connected beyond time and space, experiencing a strange
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: intra-personal deja vu. All was silent and still in that instant, and I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: saw him struggling inwardly: would he detonate the anionizers and make
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: good his long awaited plan, or would he retreat and leave the city

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unharmed, for though I was wearing the electron reflecting suit, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: collapse of all the high rise buildings would litter the ground with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: debris from them, and all on the ground would be crushed. Would he spare
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me from death, or his people? In that instant his face spoke more than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: many others' do in their entire lifetime. It was cut through with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: contrasting countenance, and yet inside of his eyes there was something
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: foreign to them shining through, something that I had never seen on his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fretless features before: evil intent. I could not tell if it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: natural to them and simply well hidden, or if it was an alien
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: expression, but it was fearfully expressed, and his eyes seemed to say,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: even at that great distance, that he took a third course, that he would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: save me, but not for my sake, instead for his peoples'. And then it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: passed, for he looked away, replaced the remote to his belt, and leapt
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to the ground, where the other Canitaurs were awaiting him. I saw him no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: more until the situation was much changed.

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: he being a foot or two taller than the others, with a graceful and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: water from a well. There were about twenty guards in the squadron that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: protected the King, but it was not so much from the terror of them that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Canitaurs fled, nor was it because of the guards that patrolled the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: walls and were sure to join any fray attempted, it was instead an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan
