author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and sophisticated, as if he were not just a warrior nor solely a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fear, some unseen presence that filled the air around him and sent his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: neighbors into a reverencing awe reminiscent of a lover's sacred
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: euphoria, intangible yet undeniable.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As I turned to him, he smiled and greeted me softly and pleasantly, in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: such a way that seemed contrary to his nature. Instead of being terrible
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and glorious like the crash of thunder or the din of waves, his voice

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was melodious, subtly so, like a soft summer rain affecting the dreams

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of a slumbering child as it falls gently on his face. There was a rhythm

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that ran through it, like poetry, yet not like average poetry, where the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rhythm is forced and the lines deformed to its ungainly warble, but like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: heavenly poetry, where the rhythm is beyond the conscious and into the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: subconscious, where it inspires a feeling of quaint remembrance of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: itself, as if it were there and not there at the same time. And while it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was soft and pleasant, it was not feminine, for it was a strong
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: baritone, reinforced by its own superiority and strengthened by its wit
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and sobriety.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Greetings, o' chosen one," he said to me, "I see that you have arrived
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: safely."

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, quite soundly," I replied, a little taken aback on two fronts:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: firstly that he was not angry or indignant that I had attempted to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: destroy his kingdom and take his life in the process, and secondly that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am glad, for I would wish you no harm, though your Canitaurian
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: friends obviously felt no such concern. But just as well, for they

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moment, or we should have a great welcoming parade for our newly arrived

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: kinsman redeemer, but they are off at the lake, inspecting the fire I

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: suppose. I must admit it caught me off guard for a moment or two, and at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our friends the Canitaurs would have gotten some notions in their heads

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of a battle, at your arrival. It must be a grand sight in any case, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not one to miss."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I gave him a strange look, for I was a bit confused myself at the

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: recalled, though it seemed as contrary to his nature as it did to the

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: through my thoughts and see my apprehension of punishment, for he

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was all that the closely built buildings would permit. In a moment or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: two we reached the Temple of Time, which was on the far side of a large
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: square plaza that opened up between it, the palace, and the government

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: center. Once we reached it, he led me inside and the guards took up post
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around its outside.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that brought its beginning about?"

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: us and the Canitaurs, for it was built by Temis himself, before the race
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of man inhabited the earth. By the time any men came to live on Daem, it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had been buried by the dirt and debris of thousands of years, but when
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Great War took place, the shock uncovered it and revealed it to men,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a sort of revelation that came only as it was needed the most. Daem's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: war started over the control of it, and to a point still is. To a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: certain extent is has helped us greatly, since the Canitaurs are afraid
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to lay siege to us in the regular fashion, for fear that it will be laid
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to ruin, and then our fate sealed in flesh and bone as well as earth and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stone. But come, there is something I want to show you," he told me.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: With that he started over to a door in the wall adjacent to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: entrance, which, as there were only two doors, was the only other exit.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It led to a long, winding stair that went up to the top of the tower
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that I had seen from below. We walked up it in silence, more from awe of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its magnificent construction on my part than fatigue in climbing its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: steep stairs, which wound on and on almost indefinitely. There were no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: windows in the tower, and only a few paintings to liven up the sparsely
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: decorated walls, yet they needed no adornments, for they were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: beautifully constructed from a strange stone that split and colored in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: marvelous twisting pattern.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: At last we came to the top. It was much like it had appeared to be from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: below, for it was a large glass sphere that sat on the tower, like the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dome on top of a light pole. It was divided in two, and the stairs went
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: right through the bottom half and opened into a circular foyer that then
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had a small flight of stairs running up to the main room. There were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: little closets and such in the empty spaces on the bottom floor. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: upper room was a good thirty feet in diameter, and the walls and ceiling
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were all made of glass, very sturdy and insulating, yet completely
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: transparent. On the floor was an odd carpet that was smooth and thin,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like a silk or fine linen, yet very strong. There was a rounded table on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the side of the entrance hole opposite the stairs, and a curved couch
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that sat against the wall behind it, cut perfectly to its circular
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: outline. Two cushioned chairs sat at the table and a small end table
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: leaned up against the couch, on top of which there was a medium sized
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spyglass, that is, a telescope.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The sun was just coming up and shining its golden hues on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: surrounding lands, which were beginning to darken as the fires of Lake
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Umquam Renatusum died down to a faint glow in the center of the forests
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the near-north. It was the first time that I had gotten a bird's eye
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: view of Daem, and I was amazed at its beauty. The plains stretched on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one side of Nunami like a broad field of gold in the morning light, its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dew drizzled grasses waving in a solemn and dignified manner to and fro
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like the constant beating of the earth's heart, and when looked upon
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: abstractly it moved as if one great beast of benevolence, holding itself
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in unison as it chorused back the silent tones of life. Its edges draped
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: down to the ocean like a curtain of woven sunlight on the eastern and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: southern sides of the island of Daem, and on the western side of Nunami
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the great forest came up right to its edge. There was a little of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forest between the ocean and the city on that side, while to the north
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there was a great stretch of trees, all the way until the ocean again
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: came into sight in the far, far north. On the ground the trees of Daem
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: seemed like mighty towers and battlements of nature, and on the treeway
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one felt suspended in air hundreds of feet above the ground on a cloud
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of green and growing foliage, but from afar and above they were revealed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in their true splendor, shooting up from the earth as if they were the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: arms of the ground itself, grasping huge clusters of leaves and branches
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: far above in their tightened fists. Some way into the forest, the ground
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sprang up into mountains that were as fierce and behemoth as the trees
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that clothed them. They were terrible to the eye and mind, as evidences
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the power that exists outside of oneself.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The city of Nunami was also revealed to me for the first time in depth.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As I have said, it was surrounded by a thick, tall wall made of stones
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and precious jewels, with four gates, one at the furthest extreme in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: each direction. It was a circular city, made mostly of the same
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: materials as the wall and temple, which were a plain, silvery stone; a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dark rock with inherent patterns; a mixture of cobblestone and a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: colorful compositor rock; and a vast array of metals, everything from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: brass to silver to platinum. Made in an ancient style, the buildings
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were tall, the average being what was equivalent to at least a dozen or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: two stories in the pre-desolation times, and they were close together,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: built along roads paved with cobblestone and lined with trees whose
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: girth, though not as monstrous as those in the wild, was still great.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There were farm fields and vineyards and orchards and meadows for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: grazing animals all within the city walls, and not just congregated
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around the outside, for there were buildings all around the wall's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: perimeter, but scattered among the other buildings in a natural and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pleasing way. In the southern part there was a lake that was of fair
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: size, and a fleet of fishing boats anchored at its shore showed that it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: did its part to contribute to the city's well-being. Several of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: trees throughout the city were especially conspicuous in their grandeur,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for they rose hundreds of feet from the ground and had great waterfalls
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: flowing down from their tops, as if they were crying great torrents of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tears down from their aged faces, though if in sadness or joy, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: couldn't tell.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: To the east there was land visible from the height at which I found
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: myself, though in the distance it became hazy and I could not make out
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its distinct features. It was evidentially corrupted, however, for it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had an uneasy look about it, as did the ocean, which was a faint, pale
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shadow of the rich blue it was in my childhood days. The sky as well was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tainted, and it looked to be filled with the accumulated atrocities of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: countless generations. The clouds were thick and bluish, and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spherical mural of the sky itself had been greatly dried, cracked, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: crumbled since my time, for it bore the marks of pain, the marks of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: labor pains of the earth's last gestating doom. And well they should, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thought, for in the years since my natural life it had seen much
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: suffering and much destruction.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The King broke the silence, saying, "Lovely, isn't it, Jehu? And it is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all yours for the taking."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What do you mean," I asked him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Exactly what I said, the whole world is yours, if you want it."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But how?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "All you have to do is join us, the Futurists, and we will reward you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with all the power and glory that you can imagine."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: At that I sobered up and replied, "But what of Onan, of my quest to stop
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the doom of humanity from materializing in this final juncture. He is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the one who sent me, and he is the Lord of the Past, whom the Canitaurs
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: follow. I am his agent, why would I turn from him to serve mere
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mortals?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He laughed a slight, sarcastic laugh, "Tell me, Jehu, to whom did he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: send you, your ancestors or your offspring?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "To my ancestors," I said slowly, "Though the Canitaurs seemed to imply
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that my time was long ago. To be candid, I do not understand."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Of course you do not understand, and how could you, when no one has
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: told you? You see, Jehu, the question of time is not so linear as you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would think. You know full well that the conflict between the Zards and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaurs is over how to address the renewing of the earth: they would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: send you, our kinsman redeemer, back into time to prevent the nuclear
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wars, while we would send you to the future to bring back its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: completion. They hold to traditions as if they were the foundation of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life, while our people have no traditions in the traditional sense, if I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: may use that oxymoronic phrase, but we look to what will come instead of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what has passed. History is unimportant to the present, Jehu, because we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: have advanced to the point that we do not make the same mistakes as our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ancestors. In the past, they waged war needlessly and did so in the name
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of humanitarian deeds. But today, we are advanced enough that we use
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: peaceful and just means to reach our ends. In your day there were many
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: absurd beliefs, for example the so-called 'fats' that were so vehemently
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: avoided, are actually quite healthy, while on the other hand,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: protectionism and socialism are quite absurd ideas, and yet they were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: held dear. But today we have no such presuppositions, today we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: understand the world and know justice where your society knew only its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shadows. We do not need to be bound by the mistakes of yesterday, for we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: have the enlightenment of today, and while the Canitaurs cling to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: old time's ways, we have progressed to the point where we have no need
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of such traditions."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He continued, "It may seem to you foolish to follow Zimri instead of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Onan, because Onan's realm has already been established and grows
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: greater everyday, while Zimri's doesn't exist and never will, but you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: miss a very important point in the understanding of these matters. For,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as you probably know, time and matter are the foundations of physical
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: existence, and while the two components are independent, they are also
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: parallel. Matter is always revolving, from its simplest form in the atom
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to its greatest in the universe, everything is revolving and rotating.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: So is time. Imagine time as a galaxy, revolving continually around the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: black hole at its center, that is, an enigma that is actually devoid of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all matter. Time is revolving around a great enigma as well, which is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: devoid of time, that enigma being eternity. Eternity is not a place
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: where there is infinite time, but rather a place where there is simply
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: no time, it is the counter-part in the temporal realm of a black hole in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the material realm. And just as a galaxy in the material realm revolves
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around the black hole at its center, in the temporal realm, the flow of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: time itself revolves around eternity. That means that time repeats
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: itself over and over again, just as on earth a year is the amount of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: time it takes the earth to revolve around the sun once, in the temporal
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: realm, an age is the amount of time that it takes the time continuum to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: revolve once around eternity. Just as every year the climate on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: earth is similar, every particular day having its usual temperature and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: weather, and every general period having the same seasons, so is time.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: While every age is completely new and original, they all follow the same
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pattern, and through every age the same general events happen, though a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: few of the small details change from one time to the next.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "So you see, it is true that Onan sent you to both the past and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: future of your original time. The Pastites would say that you were sent
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forward in time, because you existed in our past, while the Futurists
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would say that you were sent backwards in time because you existed in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our future. While this would seem an unimportant question, it is not,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for we have to choose one or the other. You, the kinsman redeemer have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to choose one or the other. That is why you were sent, you have to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: decide. Our fate must be decided by a mortal because the gods have vowed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to never interfere directly in our ways again. You must decide, Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for you hold the fate of humanity in your hands: in all the other ages
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before us, the wrong decision was made, and every time some great
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: calamity came that somehow threw the earth into a great ice age that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: destroyed all life for many millenniums. We know that the wrong decision
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was made, but we cannot tell what it was that was done. Tell me Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: will you join the Futurists? Surely you can see that the Pastites are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: just that, stuck in the past, with their obsession with traditions and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: legends. They are of the past, but we are of the future, we are the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: progressive ones. Dear Jehu, choose the future, and when the earth is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spared from the great impending doom, we will set you up as ruler of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: world to show our gratitude. Will you join us, friend?" he asked me with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the most entreating eyes, though of somewhat doubtful sincerity.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There was a deathly silence that followed, for I was thinking long and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hard about what I should do, until at last I spoke, "Your majesty, I am
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: afraid that I will have to turn you down and remain with the Pastites.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Onan sent me, and it is Onan whom I shall follow."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The King shook his head and sighed dejectedly, for a moment he looked
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: disheartened and crestfallen, but then he again resumed his former
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prideful pose and said to me, less humbly and entreating than before,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very well, I was afraid that you would do that. I have no choice now
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but to keep you here indefinitely as a prisoner, until such time as you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: realize the error of your ways and repent. It may seem improper to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: refuse the decision of the kinsman redeemer, but I must, for I will not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: allow my people to be destroyed by your ignorance."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: With that he turned and walked quickly down the stairs to the door,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: turning to me just as he reached it and adding with an almost spiteful
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: intonation, "But then again, what clarity of mind can be expected from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: someone from the unenlightened past." He then left the room, closing the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: door with a powerful thud, after which I heard a small metallic click
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and his strong, commanding footsteps fading down the long stairway. As
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: soon as the sound had died away and he was no more to be heard, I ran
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: down to the door and tried to open it, but to no avail, for it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: locked. There was no way to escape: I was a prisoner of the Zards.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 9: Mutually Assured Deception
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The light of the newborn sun rose that instant far enough above the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: horizon to shine directly into the tower's upper dome-like room, and I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was awe struck by the texture that the lights created on the glass of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the walls, for when it shone through at just the right height, a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: previously invisible picture came to view. It was of a towering clipper
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ship with sails that stretched across their masts like skin over the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: bones of a pleasantly plump fellow, the wind billowing them about at a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: leisurely rate. Waves broke gently upon the ship's side as the crew
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rested peacefully on the various cables and nets, all except for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one-legged captain who was busy looking at the map and accompanying
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: charts. It was a quaint and beautiful scene, though it soon passed away
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as the sun moved upwards in the sky, and I wouldn't have mentioned it,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: except that as it disappeared, I found myself looking at where it had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been, but instead of the ship, I saw directly through the glass the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: inhabitants of Nunami arising and beginning their daily business, a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scene which I might have missed since I was previously wholly absorbed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by the picturesqueness of the sky.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Usually the Zards would arise before dawn and be about their business,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but because of the great flames of the night before, they had no doubt
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had trouble sleeping, and therefore slept later than usual when they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: finally did fall into the lands beyond consciousness. They hustled and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: bustled about the streets of Nunami, each doing their own business, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there was much business to be done in a city in which all provisions are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: provided internally, with no trade or commerce outside whatsoever. There
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were merchants and stores still, yet they were not traders but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: producers, each making their own wares as they sold ones they had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: already made. Butchers sat in their shops with their blood-stained
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: aprons already donned, cobblers and tailors were busy with the day's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: repairs and new creations, the milkmen paraded the streets slowly and
title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moments ago that I could write it and tell all that I want, to which I

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: me that my coevals of the next age would no doubt take it as a novel.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that, I acquiesced to them and admitted that on that end my attempt to

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only that, but they were standing upright, though stooped, as if by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: weariness and the wiles of life, and they seemed, in general, to
title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sparse vegetation in the forms of small, deformed shrubs and a short,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the strange, stooped humanoids, and they were gathering the fruits of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and enjoy its plentiful resources and luxuries, yet not at all unaware

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their heart, at the knowledge of fate's unfairness and their utter
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their ignorance or anything involving their actions whatsoever, but

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: At that moment I was embittered against both the Zards and the Canitaurs
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for their selfishness and their pretensions of morality. There is no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nothing but sorrows dwell, but will not let them share the wealth that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was given one by no doing of oneself. There is no morality in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: selfishness, and when I saw those wretched people, I no longer felt like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: redeeming those on Daem from the impending doom of humanity. Whatever

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: something deeply wrong about the way they patronized me and treated me

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like a silly child, while I was the one who was to decide their fate.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: deceit and ill will, all that is, except Bernibus, which is why our

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: experienced when you wake up late to a nice warm resting place,

text: not. I breathed in the air deeply and contentedly while stretching my

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: keeping you in this position, but you must understand that the outcome

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: some time, the evident point of the sport being to gain points by making

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it so that one of the opposing players cannot get up at the end of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: round. It was so brutal that I was disgusted and could watch no more."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, I see what you mean," the King replied, "I myself would much
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rather that such games would be forsaken, but the people really enjoy
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it. I must remind you, as well, that your society had the same type of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thing, as did every other before it. It was football for you, gladiators
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for the Romans, and so forth."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But I thought that you had no traditions? That you were more
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enlightened than those of the past? You can hardly excuse your
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: misconduct by reminding one of the misconduct of another, especially
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: when you claim to disclaim the errors of history, or at least, that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: altered and redefined thing that you call history."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You are right, I have to admit," he conceded, "But let me remind you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that it is a static characteristic of humanity to confuse the ends with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the means. When an intense effort is applied, the melodramatic tendency
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is to honor that effort, despite its uselessness, instead of honoring
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the product of the effort rather than the effort itself. But, you are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: right, I admit, for we have still a few places left to refine in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: common folk."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Feeling vainglorious at my victory, I pursued him further, "I also
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: observed that your womenfolk wear face coverings in public, which is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: most certainly a thing of the past."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I must disagree with you there Jehu," he said, evidentially regaining
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his confidence and sense of moral footing, "For even in your own time
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the womenfolk all wore masks and face coverings."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was taken aback and cried, "Most certainly they did not, your history
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: books may say so, but I, dear sir, was alive and would know best!"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What, then," he coolly replied, with a sharp grin that reeked of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: self-confidence, "Would you call all the messes of make-up and perfume
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and other such things which they were virtually forced to wear? I see
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nothing different between wearing face coverings and transplanting an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: entirely new face, hair, and body on oneself everyday. In fact, our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: women got together and decided voluntarily to do so, for the very reason
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that if an artificial covering must be put on, it might as well be one
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that is easy, for why spend an hour or more a day to change one's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appearance, when it can be done in moments with a head covering? That is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a great time saver for us. And why spend the resources to research,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: produce, and market massive amounts of facial paint to cover up the face
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: when it is possible to put a covering on and get the same effect much,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: much easier? It is only logical.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "And in general, Jehu," he pursued, warming to the subject matter, "I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: find the oppression of women in your time to be quite appalling. You
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: seemed to think that the liberation of women consisted in transforming
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them into loveless, materialistic thugs, into workaholics whose only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: desire is wealth, into aggression driven beings that possessed little
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shred of real humanity, into, in a word, men. I think it would have been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a much better endeavor to have attempted to change men into women."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was taken aback by his eloquent defense of the treatment of women in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his society, and felt, I must admit, a little impressed by his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: arguments, seeing as how it did make more sense to wear a head covering
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than to paint on a face every morning. Still, I desired to let him see
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that traditions aren't all that bad, just as they aren't all that good,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and, as I had still won one point out of two so far, I felt it safe to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: move on to my main argument against his humanistic preponderance.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You are right there, I admit, but tell me, your majesty," I said with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: slow, scoffing voice, meant to show that I had a powerful point to make,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and as if I had to go slow enough for him to comprehend the eloquence of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: my speech, "Why, if you are so enlightened and progressive, so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: humanitarian and merciful, why do you keep a whole race of people, of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: human beings, stranded on the far shore, able to see the goodness of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Daem's plush lands, but unable to visit them? How can you justify the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: keeping of people in such conditions when it is in your power to relieve
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He sobered up more than he already was and answered in his most
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dignified voice, one calculated to stop opposition by its very graces,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Their plight is unfortunate, but as they are not my subjects, it is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: none of my concern."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "So you knew of them, but did not care. How typical of powerful men.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: What are they called?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Munams," he answered, "Is what we call them, though people of your time
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had a different name for them, Neanderthal, if I am correct."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: My intrigue superseded my conviction and I asked interestedly, "But, how
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is that possible? The Neanderthals were the ancestors of men in my time,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the men of my time were the ancestors of the men of this time, how
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: could they be living now?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Very simply, for your scientists and philosophers did not understand
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the revolution of time, and what they thought was evolution was in fact
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: devolution. You see, when they found all the fossils and other such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: evidence for evolution, they interpreted it to mean that they had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: evolved from lesser organisms. Since they didn't know that time repeats
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: itself over and over again, ages of time being like the years of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: earth, it was actually the remains of the age before them that they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thought were the remains of their ancestors. In truth, instead of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great comet hitting the earth and destroying the dinosaurs and many
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: other living beings, it was the Great Wars, the nuclear wars, that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: caused all the damage. And since their perception of the events was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: backward, instead of the blasts destroying the dinosaurs and the wholly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mammoths, it was what actually created them, for, you see, after the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nuclear weapons had all been used, everything in the world died, or came
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: very close to it, all that is, except Daem, which thrived, because of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the delcator beetles.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "There were no 'dinosaurs', only Zards, for when the radiation levels
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were still high and unstable, we grew to enormous sizes, and likewise
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there were no wholly mammoths, but Canitaurs. And the Neanderthals that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appeared shortly after were not the precursors to humans at all, but the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Munams, who survived on the mainland near Daem because of the corrected
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: atmosphere, but who were mutilated more than we by the increased
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: corruption across the sea. The Ice Ages, also, were not as you thought,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but instead mark the position in the last age after the doom of humanity
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was played out and everything destroyed. The Big Bang, also, was not at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the beginning, but at the very end, being somehow related to the onset
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the Ice Ages. Your evolutionary theories were close, but the time
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tables were rearranged to fit the facts, since time was thought to be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: linear.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "That is where our main trouble lies, Jehu, for through geological and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: biological evidences, even more advanced than those collected during
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your times, we can tell that something happens at this very period of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: history that will wipe all life from the face of the earth for a long
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: period of time, many thousands of years, until somehow they start to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reproduce and grow once more into what they are now. Something very
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: powerful happens, even more devastating than the nuclear wars, when all
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the nations of the world used their entire stock of weapons. Our problem
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is how to prevent it, and a great problem it presents, indeed. You see,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: while we would wish to be confident of success, since we know generally
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what to expect, we know through research that there have been many, many
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ages before us in which the same thing has happened. That is why the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: geological layers have always been found to be strangely misaligned,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with fossils from an earlier period here and with a later period there.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: That is why things like tree fossils are found in coal mines, where they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shouldn't be, and why in general, the evidence found in the ground
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: doesn't fit a consistent pattern."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As he finished, I could say nothing, for his revelation was sobering to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me, bringing me suddenly back to the realization that our doom was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: impending, that every decision I made had the potential to either bring
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: us to safety, or to supply the necessary force to hurl us viscously off
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the cliff of mortality. He was silent as well and allowed me a few
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moments of meditation to turn his speech in my mind. As is my tendency,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I looked abstractly out the window as I thought, fixing my subconscious
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: focus on the road that ran from the northern gate down through the city,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the road which formed half of the plaza beneath the temple. A moment or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: two passed like a solemn parade of mourning, then, suddenly, or at least
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: quite unexpected by myself, a party of Canitaurs came walking down the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: northern road, unharassed and unescorted through the heart of the city.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Since they came freely, I knew that they were not prisoners, but still I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was perplexed at how a party of them came to be allowed in Nunami at all
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: under such pretexts, especially as they had attempted to bring it to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ruin but a few days before.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The King saw their coming and my interest in them, and said in a way of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: explanation, "There is to be a council today between the Zards and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaurs, with you present, of course. Our war has rampaged for quite
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: some time, but we are forced to peace in light of our impending doom,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: brought by circumstances outside of ourselves. We will decide tonight,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: or tomorrow, what action to take. It is a grim time, you can be sure, my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dear Jehu, when Zards and Canitaurs meet in peace, a grim time indeed."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He said that very importantly, with an air of fright in his voice, as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one who knows his end is near, for both him and his loved ones. There
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was another moment of silence as he reflected on the meaning of his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: words, and then he rose and beckoned me to follow him. We made our way
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through the bottom half of the room and down the long flight of stairs
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that wound down the great tower in the Temple of Time. When we reached
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the bottom, we went again into the long room with the bookshelves, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: table, and the altar to Temis. Already there waiting for us were the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaur emissaries, Wagner and Bernibus.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: They rose to greet me, bowing low in a deferential manner, more out of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forced respect than awe, at least on Wagner's part, and after the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: customary blessing that followed, we all sat down at the long wooden
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: table that stretched lengthwise through the room. Wagner and Bernibus
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: took their chairs on one side and the King and myself on the other, he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and Wagner being opposite each other, and Bernibus and me being the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: same; the King and I were facing the altar and the White Eagle that held
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There was a moment of silence as we took our seats, and it continued for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: another moment as everyone sat in an awkward situation. As there was no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one else in the room besides the four of us, and as Wagner seemed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: disinclined to begin, the King opened up our conference with the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: following statement:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Well, dear sirs, what can I say, except that I am glad that you have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: finally condescended to seek a mutual agreement on the actions which are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: about to ensue, and that I hope that our conference will be productive
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and informative. Before we begin, I will outline the rules of the debate
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and of the conference, which were agreed upon before the military action
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the recent past," here he looked at Wagner with the look of a judge
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: who supposes himself morally superior to the criminal in his holding,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "And by which we will still govern the council, despite the sudden
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: change in circumstances. The rules are as follows: The decision shall be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: made by the votes of the three parties involved, namely the Zards, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaurs, and Jehu, the kinsman redeemer. A majority of two votes is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: required to decide which of the paths will be taken: the Futurist or the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Pastite. As is clearly obvious, my dear Jehu, I shall vote Futurist, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner shall vote Pastite, and it is up to you to cast the decisive
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: vote. You are the kinsman redeemer, and for all intents and purposes,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you will be the sole decider of the fate of humanity. It is a great
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: responsibility, but one that you were chosen for by the child of Temis,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the God of Time. Wagner and myself will each make our cases, though you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: know them by now, and then you will have all night to decide and you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: will tell us your decision in the morning," thus concluded the King's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: opening address.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Before anyone else could follow it up, I interjected, "But I was sent by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Onan to do his work on earth, wouldn't it only make sense for me to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: choose the way of Onan?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The King answered me, saying, "You were sent by Temis, the God of Time,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Jehu, for Onan and Zimri are his children who do his work for him, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they only have the powers that he gave them. Onan is the only one able
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to speak to mortals, for he is in the past, while Zimri is in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: future, but Onan also speaks for Zimri, because he is told what to say
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by Temis, whose agents they both are as much as you are Onan's. Isn't
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that so, Wagner?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner sighed in the affirmative, and when he had done so, I asked him
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pointedly, "Why didn't you tell me? You led me to believe that Onan was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the one who sent me, and by his own power."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Here the King put in, "He merely wanted to prejudice you to his own
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: side, Jehu. He attempted to by-pass our peace treaty of long ago when he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tried to attack us and capture this very temple for his own plans. We
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: agreed twenty-five years ago to do it this way, because enough blood had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been shed, and no good had come from it. He violated it when he took you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: into hiding, using our pursuit after his treachery as justification. But
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: come, in the face of impending doom we cannot squabble over past wrongs,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but must move to prevent future disaster from striking."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What is so important about this Temple of Time, though?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner and the King mumbled together that "It was an essential part of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the restoration of Daem", but would not elaborate, saying that it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unimportant to the present troubles. They looked guilty as they said it,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: though of what I did not know. I was reminded of my indignation at their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ignoring of the sufferings of the Munams and became once more impatient
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with their self-importance, so I yielded the floor and they began to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: make their cases. In order to decide who went first, they drew lots, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as the shorter was drawn by Wagner, he went first. His speech is as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: follows:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The past is constant, Jehu. It has happened and is secure in its place,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: explored and known. The traditions and customs of our people are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: steadfast and immovable, for they have survived the ages like a mountain
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that is untouched by the weather. They have lasted so long not because
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the mere namesake of tradition, but because they work, because they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: have worked thousands of times before, and because we know they will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: work a thousand times in the future. What was good enough for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: generations before us is good enough for us and our children. A
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tradition, or taboo, is not formed by the decision of some contemporary
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: council as a means to control others via social restrictions, for if it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was it would never have lasted, instead it is formed because of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: experience, because when something goes beyond it the result is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: temporary pleasure, the nectar of the fruits of rebellion, but when the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rebellious desires have faded, what is left is rotten and decayed.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It brings only more desires for rebellion and more thirst for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forsaking of traditions, and it will not be satisfied. Then another
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: taboo will be broken, but this also will not quench the desires of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rebellious, who do what they do not for any independent purpose, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only from a desire to break traditions and taboos and to be different
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than their forebears. But there is no satisfaction in rebellion, only in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: obedience. Obedience not to some alien divinity, not to some social
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: supremest, not to the blind devotion of parental mandates, but obedience
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to common sense, to practicality, to morality. For a taboo is not formed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by any one person, instead it is slowly built up upon the experiences of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: many, experiences which show that when one thing is done, suffering is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what follows, and when another thing is done, happiness is what follows.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Of course there are a few, isolated taboos that are based instead on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: human prejudices, but that doesn't translate into the abandonment of all
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the experience of precedents. What comes when there are no longer any
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: taboos and traditions to break? Destruction. For as is seen time and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: again, the rebellion of societies gains momentum, and while their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: consequences are slow in gathering, in the end they multiply and force
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: those societies over the edge of power, bringing only suffering and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ruin.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "And not only are the experiences of the past wielded together into that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: euphoria that eludes the rebellious--wisdom--but its constant state
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: controls the present and the future. What men have seen in the past
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: leads them in their future actions, and as a result, it is not the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: future that controls the present and defines the past, but it is the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: past which controls the present and defines the future. What sense is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there in abandoning the mountain of wisdom that the past has built up
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and leaping blindly into hazy, unknown actions and institutions? The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: past is steady, Jehu, and it is known; it is the only sensible way."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Thus spoke Wagner.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It was then the King's turn, and he said as follows:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The past is the past, not the present nor the future, its time has been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spent, its part in the theater of life is over, it is extinct. Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner speaks of us as rebelliously breaking taboos that were formed by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: our forefathers, but that is not true. In the present more is known than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was known in the past, they had outdated views and opinions, and their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ideologies were vulgar and unsophisticated. At present we are more
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: knowledgeable, more refined than what has gone before. The people of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: past waged unjust wars. They had superstition and prejudices that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: clouded their visions of morality, and the product of that is a large
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: amount of taboos and precedents and traditions that are immoral or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: meaningless. Now is the age of enlightenment, now and never before is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the future at hand, mixing with the present as we learn more and more
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: about our world. We are progressive, learning and growing in philosophy
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and lifestyle.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "If those of the past were so upright and wise, than why are they not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: still among the living? If they were so powerful, then why are they now
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: extinct? The past is gone, but the future is yet to come, it still holds
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tangible pleasures, not memories, it has promise and potential, while
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the past is only the ruins of the same. When the past is looked back
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: upon, it is small and immaterial, it is like time crumpled up into a wad
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of memories, and a time yesterday or a thousand years ago looks the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: same, for it is past, it is no more. Life is not short, but in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: retrospect it seems to be, and its memories are distant, as they float
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like fish in the oceans of time, lacking both definition and scale, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hanging lifelessly around in random arrays. Every moment is of the same
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: length, but a moment in the past is nothing, its thoughts and emotions
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: are nothing, they are gone and useless to the present, while a moment in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the future is long and touchable. A thought that is past is as nothing,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and it is forgotten, for the past and the future are like a one-way
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mirror, you can look forward into the future, but looking into the past
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you can see only the present reflected back at you. What good are the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: joys or sorrows of yesterday? They are as far removed as those of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thousand years ago, but it is the joys and sorrows of tomorrow that loom
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the largest. Why look into the past for completion, when it is found
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only in the future?" Thus spoke the King.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Once both of them had finished there was a short pause, each reflective
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and absorbed with his own thoughts. At last the King broke through the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: still waters of the moment and sent his rippling voice across its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: formless surface, which revived at once and was joined by many others,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: until the outward expression of consciousness sent the waters of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mind again into their complex and interwoven dances. He spoke in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: department of host and concluded the short session with these words,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Now the cases are stated, though but briefly, for they were already
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: well-known. As planned prior to the infractions of the treaty, we will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: adjourn for the night, and in the morning Jehu will deliver his verdict,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: whether we undo our problem through the future, or through the past."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: We all rose and Bernibus, my only friend on the island, came up to me
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and warmly embraced me, while Wagner and the King conversed formally a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: few yards away. When they were not looking and our backs were turned to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them, Bernibus slipped me a piece of paper that was rolled up into a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tight scroll. Seeing his caution and secrecy, I quickly stashed it in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the inside of my shirt, where it could not be seen. I was alarmed at the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: momentary expression of his face, which showed that he was greatly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: worried about me, and made me very interested in what the paper would
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: contain. His face quickly returned to its original countenance, an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: impermeable barrier to his insides, and no one except myself had any
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: inclination about what had happened. The other two turned towards us,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and quickly made their farewells, Wagner and Bernibus departing for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their quarters, and the King to escort me back to my prison.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He took my arm in his genially, though only superficially so, for he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: still had a subdued sense of distrust about him, and we went through the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: door to the long, circling stairway from whence we had come. As we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan
