text: ascended we engaged in small talk, the usual meaningless pleasantry,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which I assume you have probably had enough of in your experiences to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: allow me to dispense with relating it, for it was of no weight in any of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the circumstances that I found myself in, and I especially was not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: interested in it, as the paper given to me by Bernibus claimed my whole
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: attention, and filled me with an anticipation and mystery of what it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: might contain. I kept up the small talk with the King merely to allay
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any suspicions he might have had, though he had none. After a seeming
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: eternity we reached the top, and once there I stepped into my chambers,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as the King jestingly called them. We bade each other goodnight, which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was followed by the metallic click of the door locking, and the sound
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his footsteps as he descended and made his way to his palace.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 11: The Land Across the Sea
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I waited reluctantly with my ear against the door until his footsteps
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: could no longer be heard, and then waited for fifteen minutes more,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: listening carefully for any noises. There were none, and once I had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: convinced myself that I was completely alone, I dashed swiftly up the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stairs and jumped onto the couch. My sudden movements caused the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: top-heavy tower to sway slightly for a few moments, giving me quite the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scare, for I didn't realize what it was at first. But then my pilot's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instinct kicked in and I mentally calculated the height and width of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tower and the mass of the dome that rested upon it, and came to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conclusion that it was stable, for while a swift movement caused it to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sway, it would take a prolonged and deliberate pendulum-like motion to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cause any real damage, and even the fiercest wind would not upset it,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for it would only blow in a single direction at a time, and only a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rocking motion must be feared.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Confident once more of my safety, I took the rolled piece of paper from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the folds of my clothing and opened it carefully. Inside was a note from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus, written in a legible cursive that flowed from an obviously
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: educated hand. It read as follows:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "My Dear Jehu, it is I, Bernibus, your friend and comrade, who writes to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you. Wagner and myself are soon to set off for Nunami for a council with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Zards about the resolution of our conflict. It was decided in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cease fire treaty twenty-some years ago that whomever first came upon
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the kinsman redeemer was to have a council with the other side and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ancient one to decide which course to take, since either course needs
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the support of both the Zards and the Canitaurs to succeed. When you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: first came among us, Wagner seemed to break the terms of the treaty and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: keep you with us in an attempt carry out our plans independently of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Zards, using an attack plan that had been held in readiness since the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: treaty, to ensure a defense if things went wrong. When the Zards
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: attempted to capture us upon your arrival, Wagner declared the treaty
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: violated, and I assumed that it was to be entirely abandoned. I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: under this impression when I befriended you, and once our friendship had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: strengthened, I had no fears for you, thinking as I did that new methods
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were to be tried.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "After the attack on Nunami failed and the council was once again to be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: held, each having violated it equally, my fears were suddenly aroused on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your behalf. It was only then that I saw that it was the intention of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner not only to destroy Nunami and the Zards, but to capture the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Temple of Time, which was the only part of the city to be left intact.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When I confronted my brother-in-law about this, he only laughed at me
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scornfully and told me that I was soft, that I was a fool to put one
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: man's life ahead of the salvation of the whole earth. I was filled with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wrath at him and still am, but I have decided that it was better to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: feign compliance and let you know by letter what it was that is being
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: planned for you. I am only sorry that it should come to you at so late
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: an hour, when I could have warned and helped you before if I had only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: known. There is not much that you can do now, but still I must warn you,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for whatever it is worth, if only to prove my affections.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You see, my dear Jehu, the Pastites and Futurists interpret the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prophecy to mean that the kinsman redeemer has come to renew the earth,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as you have no doubt heard, although there is strong evidences to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: contrary. I myself have been brought up to this interpretation, as it is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: more acceptable than the alternate theories that exist, though I have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been for a time now doubting its accuracy. According to the Externus
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Miraculum view, the Temple of Time is crucial to the implementation of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: either plan, in fact it is the crux of them both, the one issue that it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is of as great importance, or greater, than the presence of you, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: kinsman redeemer. There is an altar in the center room of the temple, a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great diamond White Eagle that is grasping an ordinary altar in its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: talons, and this altar is where the kinsman redeemer is to be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sacrificed. If only I had suspected so before and could have warned when
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there was yet time!
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But there is no time now for such reflections, so I will continue. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: method of sending you back or forward in time is to sacrifice you on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: altar of Temis, the God of Time. It is not a traditional, atonement
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sacrifice, nor of any kind that involves the cutting of the flesh with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: knife. Instead it is a molecular one. You are to be set on the altar and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: then the White Eagle will start to spew forth either protons or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: electrons, depending on which is chosen, past or future. When your
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: body's cells absorb all of the floating matter, they will be either
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: positively or negatively charged to such an extent that their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: revolutions will be rapidly accelerated. According to theory, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: increased speed of the revolutions would cause a rift in the time
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: continuum, or in other words, would change the proportion between your
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: existence in the temporal and material realms and change your location
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in time, thereby propelling you into the past or the future, depending
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: upon which was chosen, electron or proton, past or future.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "There has been much experimentation with this process, each person sent
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through time being equipped with a matter-proof box that is basically an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: advanced time capsule, lasting for millions of years. Into this box (or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: TAB, Temporal Anomaly Box) each person was supposed to write an account
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of their temporal journey and leave it on the island that is presently
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Daem, at specific locations decided on for that purpose. We would search
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for those boxes in the present, to see if they had been delivered. None
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: have yet been found, though there are other possible reasons than death,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: such as a failure to find the island, or the box's removal by someone in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: an intervening time. Still, I am greatly afraid for your life Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: especially so after what I discovered just hours ago in the classified
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: archives of the Canitaurs: there was strong evidence that the process
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: simply disintegrated those upon whom it was tried, instead of sending
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them through time. This was kept from the public, and was forcefully
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forgotten by those who knew, their reason being that Temis would guide
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your travel better than the others who were not called as his servants.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: If it were anyone but you, Jehu, I would probably have deceived myself
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in the same way, but I cannot let you be destroyed like this. You must
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: escape and not let them throw away our only chance of salvation in such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a way. I only wish that I had known sooner, I only wish that there was a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: chance that you could escape,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Your Devoted Friend,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Bernibus"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: For a moment I could do nothing except sit in silence and ponder over
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: this new revelation. After I had reread the letter twice, so as to be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thoroughly familiar with its contents, I ate it, so that if I did
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: escape, or was apprehended doing so, Bernibus would not be found out and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: suffer because of it, though I doubt not that he would have gladly done
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: so. When I had done that, I ran down to the door and attempted to force
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it open, but to no avail. Neither could it be picked. And even if it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had, it would have done me no good, for there were at least two guards
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: always stationed at the foot of the stairs, and many more between them
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the temple entrance, and even if, by some miraculous intervention, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: made it that far, that left me stranded conspicuously in the center of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Nunami. My only hope was to escape from the island completely, for I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would be found soon enough by the cooperating inhabitants if I remained
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: upon their own lands.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The land across the sea then entered my mind, and its degenerate
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: inhabitants, but that was across a wide channel that would be hard to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cross even if I had infinite time, freedom, and materials to make a boat
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which would withstand the waves, and I had none of the three. What
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: little hope I had, then, was out of reach, lost to me like the golden
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: days of the past. It was then that I was overcome by despondency, the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hopelessness of my situation weighing my spirits down. It is a peculiar
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: trait of mine that in times of distress and in situations that seem to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: have no possible favorable outcome I act rashly and without reason. You
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: will remember how I leaned forward and peered into the dark hole when I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was stranded on the tiny island in the sea, and how I struck the tree
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with a limb on the shores of Lake Umquam Renatusum. Likewise, I again
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: did something which would seem illogical and vain: in my frustration, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pushed the table that I happened to be standing against with as much
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: force as I could muster. It slid softly along the carpeting before
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: coming to a halt a few inches from the glass wall. It made no noise or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: jarring of the floor, but the sudden shifting of weight in the room
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: caused the tower to sway once more, as it had when I had run up the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stairs to the couch.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: And, as had happened on the previous occasions, the result of my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: senseless actions was good, as if guided by some external force, for an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: idea came suddenly to my mind that would not have been there otherwise,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: an idea that was outlandish and far-fetched, but was at the time my only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hope.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I lost no time on preparing my efforts, for there was none to be lost,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and set out immediately to remove the carpeting from the floor. Upon
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: examination I found that it was not attached to the ground at all, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only fastened into a wooden frame at the walls that held it tightly in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: place. It stretched in a circular fashion around the whole of the room
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and into the center until it came to the stairs that led downward, so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that once removed it formed a circle about thirty feet in diameter with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a three foot circular hole in its center. In case I haven't mentioned
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the type of the carpet yet, which I must confess that I cannot remember,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I will do so here: it was not a traditional carpet, that form being
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: apparently lost after the great wars, instead it was a silky sheet-like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: carpet, no more than a quarter inch thick, and in fact greatly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: resembling the sail of an old clipper ship, the painting on the glass
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that I saw earlier probably attesting to the fact that it had been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: designed with that appearance in mind. Like its prototype, the sail, it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: caught a lot of wind and acted in the same general manner.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Using the bowie knife that was built into the large frontal buckle of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the anti-electron suit, which, by the way, I was still entirely wearing,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I cut the carpet down its center, making two semi-circular pieces, each
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with a moon shaped appearance, much like a wing. I based my idea in part
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: on the observation that the Canitaurs and Zards had apparently lost, or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: disregarded, the springs of my time and instead used a hammock of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: springy, elastic cords that spread across the face of the furniture.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Simply put, they stretched elastic ropes across an empty frame, almost
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like a trampoline made of individual cords. This created a very
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: comfortable springing feel, for they gave enough bounce to render the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: surface pliable, but not overly soft. Taking the bowie knife again, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thrust it into the couch, and cut away the cushioning to reveal the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: support. To my great relief, I found that it was constructed in a manner
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: similar to the other couches that I had seen. There were about two score
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the cords, each being between three and four feet long. These I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unattached and laid them down in a pile.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Next, I took the four main support beams for the couch, one running
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: along each side and two down the center in a crescent shape, with the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: same curve and slope as the carpet, as they were designed to contour the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: same wall. Then I disassembled the table and took from it two of its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: main beams, which were about a foot shorter than their curved
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: counterparts. These I did not fully remove, instead loosening their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: screws and swiveling them to extend outwards from the table at a right
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: angle, tightening them again afterwards so that they were secure.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Once that was accomplished, I went to the frame that had held the carpet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: down and took the pins and fasteners which were used to secure it. These
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I placed on the crescent beams from the couch, which used the same
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: standard size. Once I had secured the carpet sections to the beams, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: attached the couch's beams, via the cords, to the long beams sticking
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: outward from the table, running the ends of all the cords through
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: another cord that could, upon being pulled, adjust their height by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: pulling or releasing, thus controlling the distance between the upper
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the lower beams, and changing the amount of slack in the carpet that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was stretched between them. I then removed the legs from the tabletop,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: leaving just it and the beams together, the carpet being attached to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: beams.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Thus my plan was completed, it being, in case you hadn't guessed, a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: primitive hang glider, the carpet being a sail and the beams the wings,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the whole being steerable by either raising or lowering one side or the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: other, and the altitude being adjustable by raising or lowering the two
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: simultaneously. I felt keen joy at my skills in air travel at that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moment, and as I stepped back to admire my work, I felt that peculiar
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: satisfaction of having made something and finding that it was good.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: But that moment was short lived, for another problem quickly presented
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: itself, namely, how would I remove the hang-glider from the tower and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: launch it. It was far too large to go down the stairs and needed to be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: propelled to a high speed or dropped from a high altitude to become
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: airborne. Since I had no way of propelling it, I needed to launch it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from the top of the tower, which provided plenty of altitude, but then
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the problem of how to remove it from the tower arose. For a moment I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stumped and almost admitted defeat, but then it came to me.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The tower's only weakness was in its lack of protection against a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: deliberate rocking motion. If I was able to swing it back and forth fast
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enough by slowly gaining speed and multiplying the momentum, it would be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: possible to get it to lean far enough that the dome would snap off,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: leaving the room open to the air. This was possible, though rather
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unlikely. But I tried anyway.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Starting on one side I began to move from one edge to the other until a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: faint rocking motion could be felt. Then I increased my speed in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: proportion to the speed of the tower itself. It was a slow start, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the momentum began to grow, and as it did each successive sway became
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: faster and faster. Soon it was going so fast that I began to have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unstable footing, the whole tower creaking like a tree that it is blown
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by a heavy wind. The speed kept increasing until it reached its fastest,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: swooshing to and fro with all of its accumulated force.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It was then that the break happened, for on one of the thrusts the top
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: snapped off and the upper dome was flung downwards to the ground. As
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: soon as it was off I shoved the hang-glider with all the force I could
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: muster towards the edge. At first it fell, but a few feet from the edge
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its wings caught the wind and it was brought up to a stable soar, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: just at that instant I landed on it, for I had jumped right after it. I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hit with a thud and felt the craft bounce downwards a little as I hit,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but it soon regained its stability and sped on through the air as behind
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me I heard a great crashing sound.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I pulled the left wing down and the glider began to turn in that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: direction. Since I had launched into the opposite direction of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: mainland, I needed to wheel around completely, and as such I held the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wing down until I had done an about face towards the east. What I saw
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was a striking picture: the sun had just begun to rise, and under the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: influence of its soft textures the city of Nunami looked as it had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before: quaint, picturesque, and inviting. But there was a great
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: difference now, for the tower itself had completely collapsed under the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: momentum, and its ruins had fallen down upon the Temple of Time,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: demolishing it and leaving only ruins. It had also fallen on a strip of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the city, taking with it several buildings and leaving only rubble. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: King, Wagner, and Bernibus could just barely be seen amongst the crowds
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that had dashed out of doors to see what was going on, and I could tell
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that Bernibus was smiling at my escape as he looked at my wind sailor a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thousand feet in the air. A friend who rejoices in your advancement,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: even at his own cost, is rare indeed.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Turning my gaze upwards, I left Nunami and its troubles behind me and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: looked ahead to my promised land, and though it was barren and devoid of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any significant foliage, it still held something equally dear to me as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: landscape: safety. The wind currents were strong and my speed was about
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: 30 miles per hour. Great expanses of grassland sped by below me like the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: memories of yesteryear, and within half an hour I found myself over the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ocean.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There is something very refreshing about the sunrise that correlated
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: very well with my present feeling of emancipation, for it is a symbol of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the new and fresh, and of the forgetting of the troubles of the past.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: This was true in my case, at least, for I was soon carefree once more,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: secure in my freedom. As the wind rushed across my body, I was relaxed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in my adopted element, air, though it was slightly difficult to keep
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: myself firmly on the glider, as I was lying unfastened to the tabletop.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Below me passed the ocean, looking generally the same as ever, though
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: paler and less alive, like a ghost of its former self, but still close
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enough to bring the calm of reminiscing.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Soon even the ocean began to give way to the fast approaching mainland,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and I abandoned my restive meditations to solve the problem of how to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: land. I had not made any contraptions for that purpose, having not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thought about it in the hurry to leave my prison. I decided to use a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: traditional circling approach, in the same way scavenging birds descend
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: on their prey. When I was a mile or so inland, I began to circle about
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in wide spirals, narrowing them as I drew closer to the ground. In this
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: way I had slowed down enough by the time I made contact with the ground
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that neither I nor my craft was injured in the landing.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The terrain proved to be as desolate as it had appeared from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: distance, for the main vegetation was a weakly sprouting grass that was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only a few inches high, though not mowed or chewed down. Every few dozen
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: yards there was a single stunted shrub or small tree, or in some cases a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: group of the same, and the spaces between these was littered with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scattered rocks and occasionally a smaller, flowering plant. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: topography of the land was mostly flat, though not in the sense of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: plain or savanna, instead it was merely a gentle slope, so that the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: immediate area seemed flat, but in the distance it was seen to rise
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: considerably. There were also a few small hills that were no more than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: twenty feet high across their whole length, but in the obtuse slopes of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the land, even that seemed to be almost mountainous. Brown was the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prevailing color of it all for as far as my eye could see, though I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cannot say if that condition prevailed inland further, since I had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forgotten the telescope, which would probably have proved a useful tool.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: A slight wind blew from seaward, scattering the dry top soil about like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a cloud of gnats, though there were very few actual insects, and no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: animals that I could see. The only sound that I could hear was that of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the wind howling gently past my ears. I had landed in a sort of valley,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which, though not at all deep, was surrounded on all sides by slight
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hills that prevented me from getting an extensive look at the landscape
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: beyond. Before making any decisions as to which direction to set off, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: decided to climb to the top of one of these hills to ascertain my exact
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: situation, and although I was generally reluctant to start off into
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: unfamiliar territory, I also wanted to put as many miles between me and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the coast as possible, in case the Zards and Canitaurs came after me,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which was still a cause of great anxiety to me.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As I rounded the top of the hill that was directly east of my landing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: point, I suddenly came face to face with two small people, gnomes by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appearance, one of whom I recognized as being Onan, the Lord of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Past. He greeted me familiarly as 'My Dear Jehu', and introduced me to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: his partner, who turned out to be Zimri, the Lord of the Future. Onan
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was dressed the same as when I had last seen him, and Zimri was close in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: appearance, though his hair was long and his beard short, while Onan's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were the opposite. Zimri wore a little blue-green frock that fit rather
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: snuggly but not enough to be considered tight. I started our ensuing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dialog by saying this:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am more than a little surprised to see you upon such good terms with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your rival, Onan," giving Zimri an inquisitive glance as I did. "I had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: just assumed that you two would be bitter enemies, as your followers on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Daem seem to be, but I can tell now that that is not at all the case."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He laughed, as did Zimri, and replied, "We are brothers, and as such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there is always a strong rivalry, but at the same time there is the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: closest bond. There is no real conflict between us, but only a trivial
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and jovial mock conflict, the kind that means no harm and does none, to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: those involved, but rubs off on others who are less informed, who take
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it seriously and have a real conflict."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What do you mean by that illustration?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Nothing. Nothing at all," he sighed, "I have said too much already, it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: is against the rules, you know."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, yes, the rules. Tell me, though, how would you say I am doing so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: far, am I at least doing fairly?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Of course, Jehu, you are doing excellently."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Is it true about the revolutions of time and matter, then?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, in fact, it goes even further than that... Say, Zimri, do you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: think it is allowable to tell him about the physical and the spiritual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: realms?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Zimri said nothing, for he can say nothing, but he did nod his head in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the affirmative. Thus sanctioned by his brother, Onan continued to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: speak, "Well, you know that physical existence is comprised of time and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: matter, and that both of these are involved in a revolving motion, from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the minutest foundations to the largest additions. While they both are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: revolving within themselves, they are also revolving together, around an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enigma which, as other of the centers, is completely devoid of the thing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which revolves around it, but is found plentifully in them. In the case
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of matter, it revolves around a black hole, in which there is not found
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any matter, but there are places of emptiness inside of the matter, in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fact, most of an atom is empty space. In the case of time, it revolves
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around eternity, an enigma where there is no such thing as time, even as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there are certain areas where no time exists in physical existence, such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as a book. Likewise, physical existence, which is a combination of time
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and matter, revolves around a place in which there is no physical
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: existence, namely, the spiritual realm. There is no physical in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spiritual, but there is spiritual in the physical. Physical existence is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not whole without the spiritual, which binds it together in such a way
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that gives it life, the ability to think and reason.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "There is spiritual matter in everything, but it cannot be seen or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sensed physically unless it is revealed to one by a force on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spiritual side. Or rather, it cannot be understood unless revealed, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it can always be seen through its effects. By this I mean that it leaves
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a trace in the physical realm, like a jellyfish that leaves a glowing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: trail in its wake. When the brain of a human thinks, it is not the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: actual brain that is thinking, instead it is the spiritual matter that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: exists in the brain, and this spiritual matter leaves a trail where it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: goes of electric signals and such. When someone feels a certain emotion,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: such as love or depression, it is felt in the spiritual realm, but its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: traces are seen in the physical, such as certain chemicals, but these
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: are not the cause of the emotion, only the effect of them. It is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: possible, through certain drugs, to induce varying emotions, such as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happiness or laughter, but these are not the actual emotions, only their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: physical counterparts, so that while it appears to be happiness, it is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not, like the shadow of a man in a field: his form keeps the light from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: striking the ground beside him, but the shadow is not him, only the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: trace of him. Making a shadow like the man does not make the man, only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the appearance of the man. While the how of a situation may be inferred
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through physical means, the why is an entirely spiritual matter, and any
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: attempt to observe life without taking into account the spiritual matter
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: behind it will end in the same result as evolution, as the scientists of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your day generally imagined it, but which was, in fact, devolution.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The laws of the physical realm are called science, such as the fact
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that energy and matter are neither created or destroyed in any natural
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: or artificial process, or that everything left to itself tends toward
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: disorder, or that life cannot come from non-life by natural or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: artificial processes. The laws of the spiritual realm are called
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: morality. You have no doubt observed that when one does a certain thing,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the end result is always good, and when one does something else, the end
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: result is always bad. That is because there are spiritual laws that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: govern life, and just as there is gravity on the earth that always pulls
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: things down to it, so there is a spiritual law that whenever someone
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: steals something, the result is suffering for both of the parties
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: involved. Just as it is a physical law that man must have oxygen to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: live, so it is a spiritual law that when someone murders another the end
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: result is always suffering. Why is this, one may ask, but that is a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: foolish question, or at least a pointless one, for the law of gravity
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: states that on the earth, all things fall downward towards the center of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: gravity, there is no reason why, except that it is, for it is observed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: continually to be the case.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Since men cannot accept that there is a power over them, they deny it,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and in the process they misinterpret the various things of life as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: physical things, not the spiritual things that they represent. For
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instance, love: men in many "advanced," that is to say, self-obsessed,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: civilizations, view it only in its physical materializations, but not in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its spiritual context. When they see the results of love, romance
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: especially, they do not understand that the romance is only the fruit of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the spiritual essence of love, but instead think that the romance is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: love. There can be so-called romance on the physical level without its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spiritual counterpart, but it is only the shadow of love, which will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: never fulfill and will never be complete, because, by definition, it is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only a mocking of the true force of love. On the other hand, true
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: romance is not, as some would seem to think, a certain action or set of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: actions, such as the gift of a precious metal or some colorful piece of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: foliage, instead it is whatever is the result of the spiritual love, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the physical manifestation of the spiritual essence of love is not
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: confined to certain objects or actions, but to any that are sanctioned
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with its blessings. The daily toil of a poor man shows far more love
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than a lavish gift from a rich man."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When he had finished, I gave him a big grin and thanked him for his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lecture, and then asked him how it was that this did not break the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rules, but other things did. To this he replied that it affected my task
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only indirectly, while the other things were all direct concomitants.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Then he asked me if I had any other questions for him, and I replied
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that I did indeed have one. Which was as follows, "I know that there was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a great war directly after my departure from my native temporal zone,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and that it was very devastating in its reach and effect, and while I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: know that the situation was very tense at the time, I was under the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: impression that it was starting to cool down once more. What was it that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: set it all off?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The disappearance of an American fighter jet off the coast of China,"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: he replied straight-forwardly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: My interest was suddenly aroused, for that was the very section where my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: squadron was stationed, and anyone who was lost would have been a close
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: friend of mine. "Go on," I told him.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The Americans claimed that it was shot down by the Chinese, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: demanded an official apology. That the Chinese would not do, insisting
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that they had done no such thing, and instead of the whole situation
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: diffusing, as you thought it would, both sides proceeded to war
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stubbornly, each thinking itself in the moral superiority. But that is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as always."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Do you have any idea whose ship it was that went down? They were all my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: comrades," I said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Of course I know, Jehu, for it was your plane."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But how? I wasn't shot down, I crash landed on an island."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But you came to me and I sent you here, and since your radios went out,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they had no idea that you were safely landed."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Still, they must have found the plane!"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "No, you know perfectly well that those islands are brought above and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: below sea level at different times. After you left, the island was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: brought below the water, and your plane was lost in the sea, no traces
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were found."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I was confused, "Onan, does that mean that I was the cause of the war?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "From a certain point of view, yes."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: He was about to say something else to me when we saw in the distance a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: group of about ten Munams coming toward us, being at that time a few
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: miles away. He then told me that he must leave me again for the present,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: as he could not interfere directly with my mission. They bid me goodbye
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and I did the same to them, and then they walked down the opposite side
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the hill that the Munams were approaching from. As they walked, they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: slowly disappeared, until they were gone without a trace, for even their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: footprints had faded to nothing.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: During the time between Onan and Zimri's departure and the Munam's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: arrival, I was left to myself for a period of inward meditation, an
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: activity that you have probably concluded that I am often given to,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which is entirely the case. This new revelation was very troubling to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me, that somehow I was the very cause of the destruction of humanity
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: during the great wars, while also the kinsman redeemer over 500 years
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: later, who was prophesied to be the one to bring humanity back into
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: balance with nature, or to thrust it forever off the edge of existence
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: into the damnation of the ice ages. As I told you in the beginning, I am
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: written in the pages of history as the destroyer of humanity, though if
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it is just or not, I am not able to judge. The name of Jehu will forever
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: be a ripple on the surface of the waters of life, and when it is heard
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: or spoken, the only feeling that it will bring will be hatred and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: disgust. If only mortals could see below the surface of the waters of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life, for just as the ocean can be deceiving on its surface, so can
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life. Time is like an ocean, but when one looks upon it, what often
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happens is that all one sees is the present reflected back in its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: surface, and the eyes are shielded from what lies below, focusing
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instead on the surface, which is so trivial compared to the abyss which
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: supports it. When one only sees the surface reflected back, then history
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and its wisdom lose their meaning, and one sees not the past but only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the present. What I mean is this: if you look to the past to justify
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: your actions rather than to guide them, you will not see the truths
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: contained therein, but only what your presuppositions already were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: before you looked, and your ignorance will be reinforced rather than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: repudiated. Wisdom is the ability to see the past separate from the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: present, but when one sees the destruction of humanity, he will see only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me, his vision being shielded from the true cause of it all, history.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The actions or inactions of one solitary soul cannot bring the end of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life, only the accumulation of the wrongs and injustices of a whole
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: race, the human race. Forever I will be eyed as the assassin of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: humanity, and yet that is not the truth at all, for I am the father of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: humanity, I am the beginning as well as the end. If you view me only as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one or the other, you do not see me at all, but only a pale shadow of my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: true self. I am Jehu, past, present, and future, I am the concentration
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of humanity in all its forms and reproductions, I am the creator and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: destroyer of every age of this temporal maze. Why am I the defender and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: executioner of the race of men? Why am I the protagonist and antagonist
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of humanity? Why am I the father and the son, the beginning and the end?
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Such a question is futile to ask in the physical realm, for here there
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: are no answers to the why's, they are only to be found in the spiritual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: realm. The physical realm is left only with the how's, and it is those
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which I am attempting to clarify.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 12: The White Eagle
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It was only a few moments after Onan and Zimri left me that the Munams
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: arrived, for they had run, spurred on, apparently, by their great desire
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to meet me. In appearance they were like I had seen from afar: hairy and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stooped, almost using their arms as legs, but not entirely. Their skulls
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were large and oddly shaped and their mouths were pushed out from their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: faces like an ape's. A limp, furry tail hung down from their lower
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: backs, and their hands had a tough, leathery appearance.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: There were eight of them, and when they drew near, the foremost hailed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: me with an eager gleam in his eyes, like one who has long hoped and long
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been denied. His voice was low and gravelly, but not at all uncivilized
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sounding, as one would have expected by his appearance, and his facial
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: expressions were equally as livid and distinctly humanoid. He began:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Hail, the White Eagle, sent by the gods to deliver us! Hail the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: redemption from paradise, coming to bring us home." With that he held
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: out his arms and embraced me in a very warm, heartfelt manner.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Hello," I replied, somewhat embarrassed by my lack of authority.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I am Ramma, leader of the Munams," he told me, "And I welcome you in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the name of us all."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Greetings, Ramma," I replied, "I am Jehu."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "We are joyous at your arrival, oh Jehu of the White Eagle."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When he said this I had a flashback, a moment of memorial deja vu, when
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the present and the past are morphed together by one thought, when one
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: idea from the past and the present exists in such a way as to connect
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the two times around it, forming a nexus between the two moments. I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: brought back to two separate times, the first being my initial meeting
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with Onan, when I saw the muraled dome, the genetics of history, and its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: depiction of the events which were symbolically representative of Daem:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the deformed man, the warring races, the worshipers of the White Eagle.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The other was my arrival in the Temple of Time, when the King showed me
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the altar to Temis, the God of Time, depicted as a great White Eagle,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wrought in diamond and grasping the altar in its talons. There was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: something about the White Eagle that connected itself to me inseparably,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: something that converged us into one form. I had a sense that it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: somehow a key to the mystery of the end times, but I could not make the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: connection. I thought back to what Onan had said to me just a few
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moments before, that he and Zimri were close friends, and not enemies at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all, while those on earth believed their rivalry was a serious conflict.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Yet while I had two separate memorial deja vu's, I could not make the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: connection between them to figure out what they meant.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Tell me," I asked of Ramma, "What do you mean when you call me the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: White Eagle?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The prophecy said that our kinsman redeemer, who would bring us out of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the lands of desolation and into paradise, who would come to us like a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: giant eagle, soaring high above the sea. Across the ocean there," he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: said, pointing to Daem, "Is Daem, the paradise land, wherein dwell our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enemies the Zards and Canitaurs. They keep us off of the island and on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the mainland by force, and here we have suffered ever since the great
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wars, in these desolate and barren wastelands, where there is neither
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life nor death, but only a hazy in between. An ancient one with wings
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: like an eagle was to come and rescue us, the White Eagle, and under his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: guidance we are to be led to victory against our enemies.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "To them he would be sent first, humbly he would come to redeem them
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from the woes of their own causing, but they would receive him not.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Instead they cast him away, and he was to come to us, to bring us to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: promised land. What a blessed sight it was when we saw you soaring
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through the sky on your white wings, and now you have come, my dear
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Jehu, you have come at last, in the hour of our greatest need. Come, oh
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: White Eagle, and let us go to Kalr, our city. Tonight is the Feast of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Hershonites, celebrating the night that the prophecy was received,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and on the same day shall it be fulfilled!"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: With that he turned and set off with a step of exuberance to the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: northwest, the other Munams and myself following him. He walked quickly,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and it was all that I could do to match his pace, so that I was left
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: without breath enough to ask any more questions. From what I saw on our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: journey, the landscape was the same across the whole mainland that was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: near to the coast, and there was neither change enough nor any landmark
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: conspicuous enough for me to take any bearings. Without the Munam's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: company, I would have been lost.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Ramma led us on a straight course for about half an hour, there being
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nothing to steer around, and when that time had elapsed, we found
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ourselves in a small, battered city. There were no great buildings or
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: infrastructure like in Nunami, nor any complex labyrinths like the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaur's military base. Instead there were only weak, unsound huts,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: built with a framework of oddly shaped driftwood and covered with a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: thick layer of insulating sod. A road ran through the center of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: city, only distinguishable because it was packed down by constant use,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and on either side were groupings of the huts in semi-circular patterns,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with no space between them left unfilled by soil. This created a wind
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: barrier, preventing the strong winds that whipped across the desert
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lands from harassing the inhabitants as they worked and played in their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: communal yards. Each such grouping had a field of a strange, potato-like
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: plant that spread across the back ends of the houses, where the fierce
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: winds piled up loads of nutrient rich top soil from miles and miles
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around. In the center of the protected areas, each of the communities,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for such they were called, had a well that reached hundreds of feet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: downwards, bringing them almost unlimited supplies of fresh water. Using
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: these two major systems, they were able to live in a comfortable manner,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not comfortable in a sense of comparison with the Zards or Canitaurs,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: but comfortable in the sense that they had food to eat, clothes to wear,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and shelter to protect them. Under such conditions humanity can thrive,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for happiness is not found in the accumulation of excess comforts, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in the accumulation of excess love. This the Munams had plenty of, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from that point of view were more the evolutionary form of humanity than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the devolutionary.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The Munams all wore a sort of close fitting frock, a plain colored one
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: piece suit that displayed their practicality and modesty. It is a hobby
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of mine to observe the clothing worn by different groups of people and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: compare it to their characteristics. As I have said before, clothes do
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not make the man, but the man certainly makes the clothes, and it is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: possible to judge a person's character by the type of attire that they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wear, in that it is an expression of their tastes. The Munams were shown
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by their clothing to be a very friendly people, for their frocks were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hung gently about the body in a manner that was at once both carefree
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and conservative. This is perfectly analogous to their personalities.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When we came down through the center street, which was really the whole
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: city, for there were no other roads, the people rushed out to meet us,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and when they were told that it was the White Eagle, they began to dance
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: joyously about in the streets. There was laughter and play going on all
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: at once, and it was like a great burden lifted from my heart to see them
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rejoicing, for it almost reconciled their sufferings with the Zard's and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Canitaur's ease of life, in that they seemed to be much more happy, in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spite of the circumstances.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Ramma gave a short speech to the people, in which he detailed the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: prophecy and its fulfillment and, in general, encouraged everyone to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hope for what was to come. When it was over, he and I retired to his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: home, which was rather larger than the others and formed its own
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: semi-circle, containing as it did both his private quarters and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: official offices of the government, which, while extremely limited in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: number, were well outfitted. The door of this building opened into a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: short hallway that had several doors adjacent to it. He led me down
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan
