text: one of these and it proved to be a dining hall, though it was not as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: commodious as most, with only a round wooden table with a few chairs
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around it and some cupboards and cabinets.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Pulling my chair out for me to sit in, Ramma went through all the normal
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: duties of host with great ease, and within a few moments we were eating
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: heartily from a great dish of boiled potatoes that had been brought in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by a servant, or rather, a deputy minister of state, for such was his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: title. We did little talking before we ate, because I was greatly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: famished and as such was ill-inclined to be jovial, not that I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sullen, but I found it hard to be completely relaxed without a full
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: stomach. Yet when that was remedied and I found myself satisfied and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: comfortable in a warm dwelling, I opened up to Ramma and we had a long
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and entertaining discussion, some of which I will record here, as it
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shines a little more light upon the mysteries of my story:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "So, my dear Jehu," Ramma began, "I trust your stay on Daem has so far
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been enjoyable."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I chuckled quietly and told him, "No, not entirely, for there is a war
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: afoot on Daem, or at least there seemed to be, and it made quite a bit
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of trouble for me."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I'm sorry to hear that," he replied, "But also gratified, for it will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: help us in our offensive if they are against each other as well as us.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Still, it will be hard."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "What offensive is that?" I asked, my interest being perked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Our jihad, to capture the lands which were meant for us and reclaim
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them from the filth that now inhabit them. You are our kinsman redeemer,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Jehu, but it is not with your presence alone that we will be brought
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: victory, for we also must act. Ever since the prophecy was given we have
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: been preparing for a strike that will catch the Zards and Canitaurs by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: surprise, for those are our only advantages: time and surprise. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: carrying out of the surprise attack is the hardest part, and we decided
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: long ago to dig a tunnel under the sea to bridge Daem and the mainland,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for if we had made a fleet of ships, or attempted anything on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: surface, they would have seen and known what we intended to do. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tunnel is very long, and it was an arduous task to undertake, but with
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: much patience we prevailed, and now it is complete. In fact, it was only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: completed yesterday, though it was started more than 500 years ago."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "How is it that you started so long ago and only finished just before I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: arrived? I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Fate," he answered, "All the happenings of the world are controlled by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a force much greater than us, and it brings everything into completion
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: when it is needed, no sooner and no later. Many civilizations try to out
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wit fate, but they cannot, and in the end they do its bidding. Not,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: however, in the way they had planned, and with more consequences than
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they would like, at which point they try to change fate again and undo
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: those consequences, and soon they are in a downward spiral of such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: deeds. We recognize that we are controlled by fate, and instead of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fighting it, we go along with it. We know that things will happen as
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they are meant to happen, and we knew that 500 years ago, so it was no
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great trial for us to work at our task for so long and not to know when
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: things would be brought to completion. You see, if we had worried about
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it and attempted to change to course of events that history dictated,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than we would have only given ourselves more work for the same end.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Stress is the only thing that is created when you try to alter fate, so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: it is our philosophy to take things as they come and trust to the powers
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that be. You may think it unsophisticated, but that is just as well, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: what matters is not appearances, but reality, and we have the two things
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that matter most in life: peace and joy."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I agreed with him, for I had found the same to be true in my own
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: experiences. I then asked him, "When will this grand offensive be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: undertaken?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Tomorrow," he said bluntly.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Tomorrow? Isn't that rather soon?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Why? Fate has been fulfilled so far, why wait when it is time to act?
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Maybe you misunderstood my meaning: it is not our philosophy to simply
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: let things go as they will. Instead we relax and let things take their
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: course when it is not in our power to do anything effective, but when
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the time comes to act, we act swiftly and do not delay. In a word, we do
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not force fate, either by forcing action where patience is needed, nor
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by forcing patience where action is needed."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "That sounds well enough," I said, "But the difficulty lies in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: correct classification of the situation, or in other words, deciding if
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: patience or action is needed."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, of course, but in this case it has been decided to attack
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: tomorrow, and there is nothing left to do but to attack tomorrow. But do
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not yet let your spirits be dampened by the onset of war, for tonight is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Feast of the Hershonites, and there will be great celebrating and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rejoicing this evening. Forget about the troubles of tomorrow and enjoy
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the celebrations of today, as I always say. And it is now time for the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: celebrating to begin, so let us be off."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: And with that we both rose and took our plates into the kitchen that was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: connected to the dining hall on the opposite side as the hallway and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: deposited our plates to be cleaned later (for even the leaders of a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: society must do their fair share of the work). Then we walked back
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through the dining hall, down the hallway, and out the door.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Outside we found that the people had already began to assemble on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: road in front of their communities and were preparing for the festival
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by chattering with one another as loudly as one would think possible. A
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hush began to fall upon them like a descending fog when we came out,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: though, and within a few moments it had died down to a ghostly silence,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for all that could be heard was the wind's constant blowing. Ramma took
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the head of the procession of Munams that had formed on the road, and I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: took the place next to him. With a sort of quiet anticipation of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: joys to come, there was little movement, and what little there was, was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hushed by a sense of subdued excitement. Then, with a somber gait, Ramma
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: began the parade down the road, in the opposite direction as we had come
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: from, that being northwest, and all followed him as he did.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The sun at that time was just beginning to set, and once we had crossed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: one of the larger hills we came face to face with the coast, the sun's
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: great red form half sunken beneath its surface. A faint cloud layer
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: floated by and was illuminated by the twilight so that it stretched
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: haphazardly across the face of the sun. Never have I seen so profound a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: scene as that which then presented itself, with the desert sands and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ocean's still surface reflecting the last agonies of the sun's descent
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: into the underworld with such a subtle emotional undertone so as to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: render it a subconscious delight. Its recognized superiority to mortal
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: life forms left us all mute and somber, but at the same time the freedom
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: felt from the same gave us joy beyond reckoning.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The march to the sea was slow and steady, and when we finally reached
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: its shores it was just at the change of day and night. Several large
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: bonfires were lit and by their light a great communal dance began,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: everyone jumping around, running, and doing whatever their lighthearted
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: desire may have been. Under stars that shone like the twinkling in a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: newborn's eye, we had such a joyous time that it can hardly be
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: described. We were no longer within the reach of civility or social
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: duty, but without it we were not mean nor hurtful to one another, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: were playful and joyous, like children without a care in the world. Our
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: little games and frolics cannot be described with any accuracy, because
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: outside of the moment's happiness, they cannot be understood, as it was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a spiritual happiness, existing only in the spiritual realm. All that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: could be described is the physical actions that were taken because of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that spiritual enjoyment, but that would do nothing to describe the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: feeling of the night. It was one filled with more joy than anything I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: have known as an adult, because we became as children in our trusting to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fate, and it was natural, befitting to our natures. Man is not meant to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: worry, man is meant to be free from all boundaries, inward and outward,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: man is meant to be ruled by only one desire: love of others.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: As the night dwindled away, we grew tired, but instead of returning to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the city, we laid down wherever we were when we felt that we could
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: remain awake no longer, and fell to sleep instantly when we did. It was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not at all uncomfortable, for the sand was soft and a warm breeze blew
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in from the water, and though as an adult I would have feared sleeping
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: so openly in the unknown, I was not at that time an adult.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Chapter 13: The Big Bang
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The Munams and I were all awoken at the same time late the next morning
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by a loud trumpet blast that shook the very air around us with its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: intense bass. For the first moment of our consciousness we were all
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: dazed and could not fully comprehend the situation, and for a brief time
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: we all sat unsteadily around the beach where we had fallen asleep. As we
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: grew more awake, we began to understand what had happened, or at least I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: did, and I was frightened when I looked around and saw where the trumpet
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: blast had come from: the entire Zardovian and Canitaurian armies were
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: assembled around us, having somehow crossed over to the mainland in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: night, while we slept peacefully, unaware of their presence.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: My first thought was for myself, and what would become of me in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: wrath brought on by my escape, but that soon vanished when I thought of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the Munams, for they were the enemies of those on Daem, even more so
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than those on Daem were to each other. We were completely surrounded,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: with the ocean on one side and the Zards and Canitaurs circling us in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the front, the former on the left and the latter on the right. All of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: them were equipped for war, with swords, spears, and shields held firmly
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: in their hands, and thick, leather armor stretched across their chests.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: The Canitaurs had especially come prepared, for they had brought all of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their atomic anionizers with them, enough combined fire power to level
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the entire world several times over.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Within five minutes, all of the Munams had assembled behind me and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Ramma, who stood between them and the Daemians. They huddled closely
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: together and quaked slightly in fear, for they evidently thought that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: their plans had been discovered and their enemies had come for revenge.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I, myself, thought that they had come for me, and Ramma's opinion could
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not be guessed, for he was a statesman first and foremost, and when his
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: people were in need he rose to the occasion with all the power and grace
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: allotted to mortal beings.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner and Bernibus broke the Canitaur's ranks and drew near to us in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the center, as did the King from the Zard's. They reached us in silence,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and for a long moment there was no talking, for all present knew that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: something grave was about to happen, something that would decide the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: fate of the men of this age, whether they would pass or fail the test.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus looked at me with entreating eyes, showing his sorrow at my
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: recapture and asking for forgiveness, but I had none to give him, for he
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: had done no wrong to need it. He had no power among the Canitaurs, but
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: was only a titled commoner, more like Wagner's groom than counsel.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I noticed that the Canitaurs were not wearing their anti-electron suits,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: which was strange, for they had brought a few hundred atomic anionizers,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: though I didn't question them about it, for the answer was evident
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enough when I had given it some thought: the Zards had no such suits,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and were afraid that the Canitaurs would destroy them and Munams at the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: same time, for while they were allies against foreigners, they still did
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not trust each other. I still wore my suit given me for the raid on
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Nunami, though I had forgotten about it due to its comfort. That made me
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the only person on the earth still wearing one, the only one safe from
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the anionizers.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: It was an overcast morning, and the air was damp with a cold, wet wind
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that blew in forlornly. The ocean's steady swoosh added to the scene,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: making it as depressing as the night before was joyous, and in the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: bluish half light all was colorless and hopeless. At length the King
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spoke, saying, "My dear Jehu, I am very disappointed in you. Not only
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: did you flee from us irresponsibly, but you destroyed the Temple of Time
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and the altar to Temis. Without the White Eagle, the prophecy says that
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: there is no hope for humanity."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner added, "And now the only way left to bring about the completion
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of the world once more is to sacrifice you using the old methods." This
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: he said with evident pleasure, no longer feigning to be my friend.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Here Bernibus entered the dialog, throwing away his timidness with one
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: quick motion and saying to Wagner, "You scoundrel! You said that we came
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to retrieve Jehu, not to sacrifice him. How is it that you lied to me in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: such a manner?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You fool," Wagner said, "If I had had my way, you would have been dead
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: long ago. You have no authority here, so begone."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus grew angrier, a terrifying state for a Canitaur to be in, and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: he was a strong and powerful one at that, though his meek nature had
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: hidden it before. "You would never dare to kill me in the open, you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: coward, the council would banish you," he said.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Here the King joined in once more, laughing, "He wouldn't, no, but I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: would. Do you really think that we found your outpost on our own, oh
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus the 'deputy kibitzer'? You know that we have no tracking
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ability, and least of all in your own territory."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus grew more enraged, and the King was spurred on by it.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Oh yes, you know what I speak of. Your brother-in-law told us where you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and your wife were living, and not only that, for he also told us when
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: you would be there."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Bernibus became even more flushed with anger and vehemently asked
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Wagner, "Why, you heartless brute? What could you possibly value more
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: than your own sister's life?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "It was a pledge to the Zards of our intention to abide by the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: agreement, what more precious thing could I give then my own sister?" He
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spoke calmly and spitefully, enjoying the end of his long charade of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nicety, "Besides, the council was falling for her peace talk, as they
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: always give great heed to every member of the royal family, and I was
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: not strong enough at that time to control them, as I do now.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Unfortunately for me you were out at the moment of the attack and able
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to escape, but still it was a favorable outcome," Wagner said, sneering
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: at Bernibus' outrage.
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: But Bernibus was not to be taken lightly, and neither was he to let the

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: body. People of Daem, let us live in peace!" As he said this, the Zards

text: that split second, and he was peaceful. Though he was about to be

text: beyond the veil that separates life from death.

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: Chapter 14: Past and Future
title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the void, for the sun was hidden behind the darkened sky. I have no
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: memory of that period until I saw two short forms coming towards me in

text: the distance. They walked slowly and methodically, as if they were not
title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: memory.

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: rather the accumulated momentum of all the ages of humanity, for they

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to change their own."

author: Dunn, Jonathan

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: of the other ages? How could I exist in any other age but this?"

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time

text: against a rock somewhere and broken open. From that little hole, the

text: atoms of life, your life, will escape into the atmosphere and grow and

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: Then the process will be repeated. You are not only the one who

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: a descendant of yourself, simultaneously the father and the son. You

text: become the kinsman redeemer. It is your destiny, there is no other way.

text: You are the White Eagle."

text: "You only confuse me more, what is this White Eagle?"

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Do you remember when we first met, in the Chambers of History? On the
title: The Revolutions of Time

author: Dunn, Jonathan

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: You were the White Eagle, for the altar had no power, the power was only

text: in you.

text: "Those who worshiped you were those who worship time, in either of its

title: The Revolutions of Time

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: humanity by keeping men from actions that lead to pain and suffering.

title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: does not control them, for it is gone, and it will never come again. In

text: their strict keeping of traditions, they focus on the physical act of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: nothing.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "On the other hand, those who worship the future neglect the past and
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: the valuable lessons that it teaches. They believe that there is some

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: moral advancement that places them above those that have come before,

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they believe that the people of the past were blinded to the truth, and

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: that the revelation of the truth in the present supersedes the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: traditions of the past. But they are wrong as well, for humanity is
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: humanity, and those of the past were no more ignorant than those at
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: present. The people of the past fell into the same traps as the those in
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the present, and both suffer the same consequences.

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "While one group remembers only the physical display of the spiritual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: truth, the other rejects the spiritual truth because of its physical

text: display. Those who worship the future break taboos because they

author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: taboos are broken, there is nothing gained, but everything lost, for the
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: physical traditions at least lead to the knowledge of the spiritual laws

text: to those who seek such wisdom. One taboo is broken, but as there is no

text: succession. Then there is no limit to the immorality that is left to
title: The Revolutions of Time

text: freely roam the hearts of men, and when immorality, the breaking of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spiritual laws, is widely propagated, there is spiritual suffering. When
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: this spiritual suffering begins to accumulate and is translated into
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: physical suffering, the people see what is happening, how their very
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: society is crumbling to ruin around them. Yet instead of recognizing the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: truth of what is happening, they see the traditions of the past as the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: cause of their problems, and continue to make their plight worse. This
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: downward spiral continues until at last we find ourselves where we are
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: now, at the end of an age."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But what else is there to do?" I asked Onan, 'If both the past and the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: future lead to ruin?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "The answer is in the present, my dear Jehu, for if one focuses on the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spiritual laws that bring good or evil, and acts according to them,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: instead of their physical counterparts and manifestations, then things
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: will thrive and become prosperous. What is evil brings evil
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: consequences, and what is good brings good consequences, over time. The
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ends define the means, just as the fruit shows the tree to be either
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: good or bad. These spiritual laws become known and remembered, not why
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they are so, but simply that they are so. No one can question why, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: morality is observed through its effects, just as science is. When
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: people observe that one thing brings good and another bad, they remember
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: to stay away from the bad things and cling to the good. Over time these
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: evolve into taboos and social restrictions, not meaningless laws
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enforced by tyrants for their own reasons, but rules that are observed
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by all because the are the laws of the spiritual realm and govern
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: physical life. But when the people forget what the traditions represent,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: then all is lost, and either of the two paths that present themselves
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: lead to ruin."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "But why do not men see?"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Because they are rooted too strongly in the physical realm, and cannot,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: or will not, see the spiritual. What they see as happiness is not the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spiritual matter that is happiness, but the physical actions the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: represent happiness. What they see as love is not love in the spiritual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: sense, only its manifestation in the physical realm. When they see the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happiness that comes from a spiritual connection, they seek after it.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: But they do not seek after the actual essence of the spiritual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: connection, yet after its physical counterpart, marriage. This they take
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: and defile, and when they go through the physical actions of the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: spiritual marriage but forsake the very thing that makes it bring
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: happiness, they are left without any real sense of satisfaction, without
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any real happiness.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You must understand that the physical manifestation of the spiritual
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: force is not the spiritual force at all, only a bland deception. If you
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: only focus on what you can see directly, than you chase after only the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: representation and not the object desired. If a bird is flying through
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: the sky at noontime, casting a shadow on the ground below him, and a man
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: comes along, and in the hope of catching the bird chases after its
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shadow, it is evident that he will never catch it, for when he does
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reach it, he will find that there is nothing there at all, only the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: shadow of what it was he desired. So it is with the spiritual!"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Yes, I think that I am beginning to understand."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Excellent. If only I could tell you more, but I must go, my dear Jehu,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: for Father Temis is in mourning for his children, and I must go to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: comfort him."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "I thought that you and Zimri were his children?" I asked.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "You are all his children. He is patient, ever so patient, but still
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: they fall by the wayside, too caught up in their false perception to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: rest in him. Fare thee well, Jehu, may you be blessed ere you must die."
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: And with that, Onan and Zimri turned and walked away in the other
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: direction, never to be seen by me again, in this age. I took a look
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: around me, and could not bear to remain any longer in a place of such
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: ill remembrance. Turning slowly and despondently to the westward, I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: began to walk over the lifeless mass of what had been the ocean not too
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: long ago. For how long I walked, I could not tell, but in due time I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: reached Daem, though it was no more hospitable than the mainlands, for
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: all was laid to ruin by the Big Bang, all was equally devoid of life.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: When I came to what had been the center of the savanna, I came across
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: something that had survived the blast, being unearthed from its previous
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: burial hole by the force of the anionizer's explosion. It was a two foot
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: by two foot box, made of a strange metallic substance with an intricate
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: etching along its top. Written there in its center were these words:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: "Temporal Anomaly Box, Number 12, Location: Central Savanna"
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: I took the lid off carefully, though it was in perfect condition and I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: did not need to treat it so, and looked inside of it. There was a
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: notebook and a pen there, both capable of producing a large of amount of
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: enduring text. This was one of the boxes that had been taken back
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: through time in the experiments of the Zards and Canitaurs, designed to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: withstand any conditions, and to hold its contents for countless ages,
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: until they should be retrieved and studied. I sat down on the ground and
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: began to write my story down, in order to assist whoever takes the job
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: of kinsman redeemer in the next age. I knew that it would have all been
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: forgotten, so I made sure to carefully record it, for it could mean the
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: difference between the life and death of humanity.
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: This was only hours ago, and now I have reached the end my tale. If by
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: any chance you come upon this in some subsequent age, I beg you to take
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: heed, for what I have written will surely come to pass once more if
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: something is not done to prevent it. There is nothing else for me to
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: say, for this is the end of my story, and within the next day I will
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: also pass over to the spiritual realm. What, then, can I say to bring
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: this to a close, for this is neither the end nor the beginning. I
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: suppose all that can be said is this:
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan

text: DEJA VU (THE END)
title: The Revolutions of Time
author: Dunn, Jonathan
